use a crescent wrench to tighten the crank arm puller by twisting clockwise until the puller cannot be tightened further .
do not over tighten the crank arm puller . once it begins to become hard to tighten , stop .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the crank arm puller into the hole that the screw was occupying. Use a crescent wrench to tighten the crank arm puller by twisting clockwise until the puller cannot be tightened further. Do not over tighten the crank arm puller. Once it begins to become hard to tighten, stop.

Lines.Text: turn the crank arm puller clockwise until the crankarm pops off .
there will be some resistance when taking the crank arm off .
repeat steps 2-4 on the other side of the bike to remove the other crank arm .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the crank arm puller clockwise until the crankarm pops off. There will be some resistance when taking the crank arm off. Repeat steps 2-4 on the other side of the bike to remove the other crank arm.

Lines.Text: flip the crank arm , that has the chain-guard on it , over so that the chainring shows .
locate the four screws on the back of the chain ring .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the crank arm, that has the chain-guard on it, over so that the chainring shows. Locate the four screws on the back of the chain ring.

Lines.Text: use a phillips head screwdriver to remove the four screws on the back of the chain ring .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Phillips head screwdriver to remove the four screws on the back of the chain ring.

Lines.Text: flip chain guard back over so that the chain guard faces you .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip chain guard back over so that the chain guard faces you.

Lines.Text: grasp the crankarm in one hand and the chain guard in the other .
gently , pull out and up on the chain guard until the guard pops off .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the crankarm in one hand and the chain guard in the other. Gently, pull out and up on the chain guard until the guard pops off.

Lines.Text: use a 2 flathead screwdriver to remove the five screws on the body of the magneto

Steps.Text_raw: Use a #2 Flathead screw driver to remove the five screws on the body of the magneto

Lines.Text: locate the spark plug lead .
use a milbar snap ring plier to remove the snap ring .
the snap ring can be difficult to remove . make sure the pliers needles go into the holes of the snap ring .
wear safety goggles when removing the snap ring . the snap ring can shoot out on accident .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the spark plug lead. Use a Milbar snap ring plier to remove the snap ring. The snap ring can be difficult to remove. Make sure the pliers needles go into the holes of the snap ring. Wear safety goggles when removing the snap ring. The snap ring can shoot out on accident.

Lines.Text: remove the gear to replace it .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the gear to replace it.

Lines.Text: use a 2 flathead screwdriver to remove the five screws on the body of the magneto .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a #2 Flathead screw driver to remove the five screws on the body of the magneto.

Lines.Text: locate the two screws on the back of the magneto that holds the capacitor in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two screws on the back of the magneto that holds the capacitor in place.

Lines.Text: use a 2 flathead screwdriver to remove the screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a #2 Flathead screw driver to remove the screws.

Lines.Text: remove the capacitor and replace it .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the Capacitor and replace it.

Lines.Text: use a 9 /16 wrench to unscrew the nut on the drive shaft .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a 9/16 wrench to unscrew the nut on the drive shaft.

Lines.Text: remove the lock washer underneath the nut .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the lock washer underneath the nut.

Lines.Text: pull away the impulse coupling .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull away the impulse coupling.

Lines.Text: use a 9 /16 wrench to unscrew the nut on the drive shaft .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a 9/16 wrench to unscrew the nut on the drive shaft.

Lines.Text: remove the lock washer underneath the nut .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the lock washer underneath the nut.

Lines.Text: pull away the impulse coupling .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull away the impulse coupling.

Lines.Text: use a pliers to remove the woodruff key .
if the key seems stuck , use a 2 flathead screwdriver to unjam the key .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pliers to remove the Woodruff key. If the key seems stuck, use a #2 Flathead screwdriver to unjam the key.

Lines.Text: you will need the allen wrench 3 /16 for this first step .
unscrew the silver cap with the allen wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: You will need the Allen Wrench 3/16" for this first step. Unscrew the silver cap with the Allen Wrench.

Lines.Text: you will need the allen wrench 7 /32 for this step .
loosen all four of the screws using the allen wrench so that the handlebars can be wiggled off the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: You will need the Allen Wrench 7/32" for this step. Loosen all four of the screws using the Allen Wrench so that the handlebars can be wiggled off the frame.

Lines.Text: when loose enough , slide the handlebars off the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: When loose enough, slide the handlebars off the frame.

Lines.Text: insert bolt hardware through the factory drilled holes from the top side of the skateboard .
if you have a riser and would like to install it , please reference the guide guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert bolt hardware through the factory drilled holes from the top side of the skateboard. If you have a riser and would like to install it, please reference the [guide|11251|Wheel Bite Prevention] guide.

Lines.Text: slide the truck onto the four protruding bolt hardware screws , while using your hand to prevent the screws from popping out the top of the skateboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the truck onto the four protruding bolt hardware screws, while using your hand to prevent the screws from popping out the top of the skateboard.

Lines.Text: hand tighten the nut hardware onto all four bolts .

Steps.Text_raw: Hand tighten the nut hardware onto all four bolts.

Lines.Text: while holding the nuts on the bottom side of the skateboard in place with the 3 /8 wrench , tighten the screws from the top side of the skateboard with a screwdriver . tighten the screws in a diagonal pattern until the head of the screw sinks slightly into the grip tape .
repeat steps 1 - 6 to install the second truck .

Steps.Text_raw: While holding the nuts on the bottom side of the skateboard in place with the 3/8" wrench, tighten the screws from the top side of the skateboard with a screwdriver.  Tighten the screws in a diagonal pattern until the head of the screw sinks slightly into the grip tape. Repeat steps 1 - 6 to install the second truck.

Lines.Text: protect your work area such as a desk with paper towels or newspaper .
be sure that the environment in which you are performing this work is well ventilated and uncarpeted .
remove your bearings from your wheels , if they are not removed already . please reference the guide guide for information on how to properly remove bearings .

Steps.Text_raw: Protect your work area such as a desk with paper towels or newspaper. Be sure that the environment in which you are performing this work is well ventilated and uncarpeted. Remove your bearings from your wheels, if they are not removed already.  Please reference the [guide|11243|Wheel Installation] guide for information on how to properly remove bearings.

Lines.Text: set out your two metal containers and fill them with just enough of your citrus based cleaner to fully submerge one bearing . one container will be for cleaning and one will be for rinsing .
be sure to wash your hands when finished dealing with the citrus based cleaner as these chemicals can be harsh on skin . gloves are optional but recommended .

Steps.Text_raw: Set out your two metal containers and fill them with just enough of your Citrus Based Cleaner to fully submerge one bearing.  One container will be for cleaning and one will be for rinsing. Be sure to wash your hands when finished dealing with the Citrus Based Cleaner as these chemicals can be harsh on skin. Gloves are optional but recommended.

Lines.Text: remove one shield from your bearing using the small point of a utility knife . this will allow the chemicals to enter the bearing more freely when the bearing is submerged .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove ONE shield from your bearing using the small point of a utility knife.  This will allow the chemicals to enter the bearing more freely when the bearing is submerged.

Lines.Text: submerge your bearing in the cleaning container for 15 - 20 seconds to allow the solvent to soak into the bearing .

Steps.Text_raw: Submerge your bearing in the cleaning container for 15 - 20 seconds to allow  the solvent to soak into the bearing.

Lines.Text: after submerging the bearing , remove it from the cleaning solution and begin to scrub off any dirt or grease with a toothbrush .
you may also scrub the shield that you removed so that it can be cleaned as well .

Steps.Text_raw: After submerging the bearing, remove it from the cleaning solution and begin to scrub off any dirt or grease with a toothbrush. You may also scrub the shield that you removed so that it can be cleaned as well.

Lines.Text: when finished scrubbing the bearing , rinse it in fresh cleaning solution until there is no dirt or old lubricant in the bearings . then set this bearing aside .
repeat steps 4 - 7 for your remaining seven bearings . be sure to continue to refresh your rinsing solution if it becomes too dirty .

Steps.Text_raw: When finished scrubbing the bearing, rinse it in FRESH cleaning solution until there is no dirt or old lubricant in the bearings.  Then set this bearing aside. Repeat steps 4 - 7 for your remaining seven bearings.  Be sure to continue to refresh your rinsing solution if it becomes too dirty.

Lines.Text: once you have cleaned all of your bearings , use a can of compressed air to blow any of the cleaning solution out of the bearings .
do this as soon as possible to prevent rust from forming .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have cleaned all of your bearings, use a can of compressed air to blow any of the cleaning solution out of the bearings. Do this as soon as possible to prevent rust from forming.

Lines.Text: carefully blot your bearing with a lint-free cloth to remove any excess cleaning solution .
be careful not to get any fibers stuck in the bearing . one tiny piece of hair or lint can severely reduce the performance of your bearing .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully blot your bearing with a lint-free cloth to remove any excess cleaning solution. Be careful not to get any fibers stuck in the bearing.  One tiny piece of hair or lint can severely reduce the performance of your bearing.

Lines.Text: after you have thoroughly dried your bearing , you can now relubricate the bearing . to do this , simply coat all inside parts with the lubricant and spin the bearing in order to disperse the lubricant fully .
make sure to spin the bearing immediately after the lubrication process .
warning ! the bearing lubricant is harmful if swallowed and can cause skin irritation . be sure to keep away from open flames because the lubricant is flammable .

Steps.Text_raw: After you have thoroughly dried your bearing, you can now relubricate the bearing.  To do this, simply coat all inside parts with the lubricant and spin the bearing in order to disperse the lubricant fully. Make sure to spin the bearing immediately after the lubrication process. Warning!  The bearing lubricant is harmful if swallowed and can cause skin irritation.  Be sure to keep away from open flames because the lubricant is flammable.

Lines.Text: carefully wipe the bearing with a lint-free cloth that is slightly oily . after this you can replace the protective shield by simply pressing it into place .
repeat steps 8 - 7 for all other bearings . after you have completely relubricated all of your bearings , see the guide guide to help you install your bearings into your wheels .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully wipe the bearing with a lint-free cloth that is slightly oily.  After this you can replace the protective shield by simply pressing it into place. Repeat steps 8 - 7 for all other bearings.  After you have completely relubricated all of your bearings, see the [guide|11243|Wheel Installation] guide to help you install your bearings into your wheels.

Lines.Text: using the 4 mm allen wrench , partially unscrew the 4 ( 22 mm ) hex screws on the front of the axle casing to allow the axle to slide freely .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 4mm Allen wrench, partially unscrew the 4 (22mm) hex screws on the front of the axle casing to allow the axle to slide freely.

Lines.Text: using the 8 mm allen wrench , loosen the axle screw until 1 /2 of the axle screw is visible .
push the axle screw to reveal the axle rod on the other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 8mm Allen wrench, loosen the axle screw until 1/2 of the axle screw is visible. Push the axle screw to reveal the axle rod on the other side.

Lines.Text: using the allen wrench , finish unscrewing the axle screw and pull it out .
hold the wheel when pulling out the axle rod so that the bike does not fall .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Allen wrench, finish unscrewing the axle screw and pull it out. Hold the wheel when pulling out the axle rod so that the bike does not fall.

Lines.Text: pull the wheel from the fork .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the wheel from the fork.

Lines.Text: using the 4 mm allen wrench , partially unscrew the 4 ( 22 mm ) hex screws on the front of the axle casing to allow the axle to slide freely .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 4mm Allen wrench, partially unscrew the 4 (22mm) hex screws on the front of the axle casing to allow the axle to slide freely.

Lines.Text: using the 8 mm allen wrench , loosen the axle screw until 1 /2 of the axle screw is visible .
push the axle screw to reveal the axle rod on the other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 8mm Allen wrench, loosen the axle screw until 1/2 of the axle screw is visible. Push the axle screw to reveal the axle rod on the other side.

Lines.Text: using the allen wrench , finish unscrewing the axle screw and pull it out .
hold the wheel when pulling out the axle rod so that the bike does not fall .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Allen wrench, finish unscrewing the axle screw and pull it out. Hold the wheel when pulling out the axle rod so that the bike does not fall.

Lines.Text: pull the wheel from the fork .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the wheel from the fork.

Lines.Text: twist and pull off the cap covering the tire valve
twist off the spacer that holds the valve in place .
push valve in toward wheel to release air pressure .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist and pull off the cap covering the tire valve Twist off the spacer that holds the valve in place. Push valve in toward wheel to release air pressure.

Lines.Text: insert one tire lever between the tire and the rim .
push down on the tire lever until the edge of the tire is higher than the edge of the rim .
insert a second tire lever next to the first .
slowly slide one tire lever around the rim until the tire is released from the rim .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert one tire lever between the tire and the rim. Push down on the tire lever until the edge of the tire is higher than the edge of the rim. Insert a second tire lever next to  the first. Slowly slide one tire lever around the rim until the tire is released from the rim.

Lines.Text: using your hand , pull the tube completely out of the tire .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your hand, pull the tube completely out of the tire.

Lines.Text: use an 8 mm allen wrench to unscrew the 6 ( 4x10 mm ) screws on the brake rotor .
pull brake rotors off both sides of the wheel .

Steps.Text_raw: Use an 8mm Allen wrench to unscrew the 6 (4x10mm) screws on the brake rotor. Pull brake rotors off both sides of the wheel.

Lines.Text: pull the tire from the rim .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the tire from the rim.

Lines.Text: using a tire lever , push the rim tape aside to reveal the spoke nipple .
using your fingers , pull off the old spoke nipple .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a tire lever, push the rim tape aside to reveal the spoke nipple. Using your fingers, pull off the old spoke nipple.

Lines.Text: push out the old spoke from the hub .

Steps.Text_raw: Push out the old spoke from the hub.

Lines.Text: insert a new 250 mm spoke into the hub .
align the spoke with the spoke nipple in the rim .
try to keep the spoke as straight as possible when threading it around the other spokes . slight bends will be taken out when it is tightened .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert a new 250mm spoke into the hub. Align the spoke with the spoke nipple in the rim. Try to keep the spoke as straight as possible when threading it around the other spokes. Slight bends will be taken out when it is tightened.

Lines.Text: using an sw-1 spoke wrench , tighten the spoke .

Steps.Text_raw: Using an SW-1 spoke wrench, tighten the spoke.

Lines.Text: using the 4 mm allen wrench , partially unscrew the 4 ( 22 mm ) hex screws on the front of the axle casing to allow the axle to slide freely .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 4mm Allen wrench, partially unscrew the 4 (22mm) hex screws on the front of the axle casing to allow the axle to slide freely.

Lines.Text: using the 8 mm allen wrench , loosen the axle screw until 1 /2 of the axle screw is visible .
push the axle screw to reveal the axle rod on the other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 8mm Allen wrench, loosen the axle screw until 1/2 of the axle screw is visible. Push the axle screw to reveal the axle rod on the other side.

Lines.Text: using the allen wrench , finish unscrewing the axle screw and pull it out .
hold the wheel when pulling out the axle rod so that the bike does not fall .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Allen wrench, finish unscrewing the axle screw and pull it out. Hold the wheel when pulling out the axle rod so that the bike does not fall.

Lines.Text: pull the wheel from the fork .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the wheel from the fork.

Lines.Text: using the 8 mm allen wrench , unscrew 2 ( 32 mm ) screws to release the brake calipers from the fork .
if necessary use wire cutters to release zip ties attaching cables to the forks .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 8mm Allen wrench, unscrew 2  (32mm) screws to release the brake calipers from the fork. If necessary use wire cutters to release zip ties attaching cables to the forks.

Lines.Text: using the 8 mm allen wrench , unscrew the 30 mm head screw located on top of the steam .
using the 4 mm allen wrench , loosen the side screw on both sides .
lift off the handlebar .
hang the handlebar gently from the cables . do not pull the cables as you may damage the brake/derailleur lines .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 8mm Allen wrench, unscrew the 30mm head screw located on top of the steam. Using the 4mm Allen wrench, loosen the side screw on both sides. Lift off the handlebar. Hang the handlebar gently from the cables. Do not pull the cables as you may damage the brake/derailleur lines.

Lines.Text: slide off the spacers .
lift off the seal .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide off the spacers. Lift off the seal.

Lines.Text: slide the fork out of the casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the fork out of the casing.

Lines.Text: using your fingers , pry the bearings from the top and bottom of the headset .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your fingers, pry the bearings from the top and bottom of the headset.

Lines.Text: apply wd-40 to both ends of the headset and bearings .
dry headset and bearings with paper towels .
repeat as necessary until clean .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply WD-40 to both ends of the headset and bearings. Dry headset and bearings with paper towels. Repeat as necessary until clean.

Lines.Text: using your finger , apply all-purpose lube to the bearings and each end of the headset .
insert the bearings into the headset with the beveled side facing into the headset .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your finger, apply all-purpose lube to the bearings and each end of the headset. Insert the bearings into the headset with the beveled side facing into the headset.

Title: Giant Reign 2 Hydraulic Brake Fluid Replacement

Lines.Text: pull out and rotate the quick release lever until the axle is loose .
pull back on the derailleur on the left hand side . this would remove the tension holding the rear wheel in place .
pull the wheel in a downward motion to remove the wheel .
if there is a replacement wheel the bike may not have a quick release . in which case you would need to use the correct wrench size to loosen the axial .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull out and rotate the quick release lever until the axle is loose. Pull back on the derailleur on the left hand side. This would remove the tension holding the rear wheel in place. Pull the wheel in a downward motion to remove the wheel. If there is a replacement wheel the bike may not have a quick release. In which case you would need to use the correct wrench size to loosen the axial.

Lines.Text: use a flat head screwdriver to push out on the break pads in order to space the hydraulic pistons .
the hydraulic pistons should be fully extended . this can be checked by making sure the gap between the pads are maxed out .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a flat head screwdriver to push out on the break pads in order to space the hydraulic pistons. The hydraulic pistons should be fully extended. This can be checked by making sure the gap between the pads are maxed out.

Lines.Text: slide the cover off of the hydraulic port until it is fully exposed .
use a torque spit to remove the screw on the hydraulic port of the brake handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the cover off of the hydraulic port until it is fully exposed. Use a torque spit to remove the screw on the hydraulic port of the brake handle.

Lines.Text: use a torque spit to remove the screw on the brake caliper .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a torque spit to remove the screw on the brake caliper.

Lines.Text: put hydraulic brake fluid into the syringe .
clear air out of the syringe by holding it upright , flicking on it with your finger , and pushing on the stopper until hydraulic fluid starts to come out .

Steps.Text_raw: Put hydraulic brake fluid into the syringe. Clear air out of the syringe by holding it upright, flicking on it with your finger, and pushing on the stopper until hydraulic fluid starts to come out.

Lines.Text: screw the full syringe into the port on the caliper .
screw the empty syringe into the port on the lever .

Steps.Text_raw: Screw the full syringe into the port on the caliper. Screw the empty syringe into the port on the lever.

Lines.Text: push the stopper down on the loaded syringe until it is almost empty .
do not empty the syringe all of the way . this may put air into the brake lines .
the empty syringe will fill with the excess hydraulic fluid .
always push the fluid through the system starting from the lowest point . in this case it is the rear brakes .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the stopper down on the loaded syringe until it is almost empty. Do not empty the syringe all of the way. This may put air into the brake lines. The empty syringe will fill with the excess hydraulic fluid. Always push the fluid through the system starting from the lowest point. In this case it is the rear brakes.

Lines.Text: remove the syringes and replace the port screws on the lever and caliper .
replace the caliper port screw first , then the brake handle port screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the syringes and replace the port screws on the lever and caliper. Replace the caliper port screw first, then the brake handle port screw.

Subject: Hydraulic Brake Fluid

Lines.Text: orient the bike upside down .

Steps.Text_raw: Orient the bike upside down.

Lines.Text: remove the 10 mm screw and take the bash guard off of the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 10mm screw and take the bash guard off of the frame.

Lines.Text: remove the 65 mm screw that connects the bottom of the shock to the frame .
as shown in the blue box , you will need to use a wrench to hold the other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 65mm screw that connects the bottom of the shock to the frame. As shown in the blue box, you will need to use a wrench to hold the other side.

Lines.Text: remove the 40 mm screw that connects the shock to the link arm of the suspension .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 40mm screw that connects the shock to the link arm of the suspension.

Lines.Text: push the shock out of the brackets mounting it to the frame and suspension arm .
this may require some force and slight wiggling from side to side .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the shock out of the brackets mounting it to the frame and suspension arm. This may require some force and slight wiggling from side to side.

Lines.Text: align the crossbar ( with the hole in the center ) with the screw holes on the bottom of one frame piece .
attach the crossbar to the left frame piece with two 2 frame nuts and bolts .
repeat on the opposite frame piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Align the crossbar (with the hole in the center) with the screw holes on the bottom of one frame piece. Attach the crossbar to the left frame piece with two [2] frame nuts and bolts. Repeat on the opposite frame piece.

Lines.Text: align the second crossbar with the holes on the back of the frame .
this crossbar has two square holes on either side .
attach the crossbar to the frame using four 4 frame nuts and bolts .

Steps.Text_raw: Align the second crossbar with the holes on the back of the frame. This crossbar has two square holes on either side. Attach the crossbar to the frame using four [4] frame nuts and bolts.

Lines.Text: align the left ( l ) frame piece with the brake hole on the left frame piece .
insert and tighten using one 1 brake bolt .
repeat using the right ( r ) brake with the right frame piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Align the left (L) frame piece with the brake hole on the left frame piece. Insert and tighten using one [1] brake bolt. Repeat using the right (R) brake with the right frame piece.

Lines.Text: slide the ring-shaped piece of one castor bearing onto the axle of one castor .
slide the metal tube piece onto the axle of the castor .
repeat for the second castor .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the ring-shaped piece of one castor bearing onto the axle of one castor. Slide the metal tube piece onto the axle of the castor. Repeat for the second castor.

Lines.Text: slide another ring shaped bearing piece into the castor hole on the frame .
insert the entire castor piece ( castor , ring , and tube ) into the opposite side of the hole .
secure the castor and bearing pieces with a castor bolt .
repeat on the opposite side of the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide another ring shaped bearing piece into the castor hole on the frame. Insert the entire castor piece (castor, ring, and tube) into the opposite side of the hole. Secure the castor and bearing pieces with a castor bolt. Repeat on the opposite side of the frame.

Lines.Text: insert an axle bolt through the center of a rear wheel .
insert the axle bolt with wheel into the axle hole on the frame .
tighten the axle bolt .
secure the wheel with a bolt on the opposite side of the hole .
repeat on the opposite side of the frame to attach the other wheel .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert an axle bolt through the center of a rear wheel. Insert the axle bolt with wheel into the axle hole on the frame. Tighten the axle bolt. Secure the wheel with a bolt on the opposite side of the hole. Repeat on the opposite side of the frame to attach the other wheel.

Lines.Text: slide each handle into the respective slot on the top of the wheelchair .
adjust the handles up or down to your desired height .
secure the handles in place with one bolt and nut for each side .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide each handle into the respective slot on the top of the wheelchair. Adjust the handles up or down to your desired height. Secure the handles in place with one bolt and nut for each side.

Lines.Text: insert the remaining crossbar between the handles , and align the holes on both sides .
secure the crossbar with four 4 blue tipped bolts and rubber tipped nuts ( two on each side ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the remaining crossbar between the handles, and align the holes on both sides. Secure the crossbar with four [4] blue tipped bolts and rubber tipped nuts (two on each side).

Lines.Text: orient the plastic seat with the smooth side up .
the rear strap can be attached to the seat in one of three positions in order to accommodate for people of different heights .
loop the straps over the bars of the frame on either side .
rotate the wheelchair onto its back side .
secure the seat by tying each strap together .
make sure that the straps are tied tightly so that the seat does not fall off the wheelchair .

Steps.Text_raw: Orient the plastic seat with the smooth side up. The rear strap can be attached to the seat in one of three positions in order to accommodate for people of different heights. Loop the straps over the bars of the frame on either side. Rotate the wheelchair onto its back side. Secure the seat by tying each strap together. Make sure that the straps are tied tightly so that the seat does not fall off the wheelchair.

Lines.Text: reorient the chair so it is upright .
place the seat cushion on top of the plastic seat with the angled side in front .

Steps.Text_raw: Reorient the chair so it is upright. Place the seat cushion on top of the plastic seat with the angled side in front.

Lines.Text: place the bottom of the backrest against the back of the seat cushion .
loop each strap behind the vertical bars of the frame .
secure the backrest by tying each strap together .
make sure that the straps are tied tightly so that the backrest does not fall off the wheelchair .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the bottom of the backrest against the back of the seat cushion. Loop each strap behind the vertical bars of the frame. Secure the backrest by tying each strap together. Make sure that the straps are tied tightly so that the backrest does not fall off the wheelchair.

Lines.Text: slide a footrest socket over the rail located near the front of the seat .
insert a footrest through the bottom of the footrest socket .
secure the footrest with a bolt above and below the socket .
adjust the footrest socket to your desired height .
align the socket's bolt with the nearest hole in the rail , and tighten the bolt .
repeat this step on the opposite rail .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide a footrest socket over the rail located near the front of the seat. Insert a footrest through the bottom of the footrest socket. Secure the footrest with a bolt above and below the socket. Adjust the footrest socket to your desired height. Align the socket's bolt with the nearest hole in the rail, and tighten the bolt. Repeat this step on the opposite rail.

Lines.Text: adjust the footrest socket to your desired height .
align the socket's bolt with the nearest hole in the rail , and tighten the bolt .
repeat this step on the opposite rail .

Steps.Text_raw: Adjust the footrest socket to your desired height. Align the socket's bolt with the nearest hole in the rail, and tighten the bolt. Repeat this step on the opposite rail.

Lines.Text: insert the pump bracket through the lower crossbar .
secure the bracket with a rubber tipped nut .
place the tire pump in the bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the pump bracket through the lower crossbar. Secure the bracket with a rubber tipped nut. Place the tire pump in the bracket.

Lines.Text: remove the flat tire by loosening and removing the axle nut with a 19 mm wrench .
unscrew the axle bolt with a 19 mm socket wrench .
remove the axle bolt from hole and remove the wheel from the wheelchair .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the flat tire by loosening and removing the axle nut with a 19 mm wrench. Unscrew the axle bolt with a 19 mm socket wrench. Remove the axle bolt from hole and remove the wheel from the wheelchair.

Lines.Text: insert the 19 mm socket wrench between the rubber tire and the metal frame .
any rigid flat object will do for this step .
carefully run the 19 mm socket wrench along the edge of the tire all the way around and bend the wrench down to pop the tire out of the rim .
when undoing the tire , be careful using the back of the wrench because the tool can damage the tire tube and or wheel frame .
reach inside the tire and remove the tube from the metal frame .
carefully feed the air valve through the hole in the rim before removing , or you could tear a larger hole in the tire .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the 19 mm socket wrench between the rubber tire and the metal frame. Any rigid flat object will do for this step. Carefully run the 19 mm socket wrench along the edge of the tire all the way around and bend the wrench down to pop the tire out of the rim. When undoing the tire, be careful using the back of the wrench because the tool can damage the tire tube and or wheel frame. Reach inside the tire and remove the tube from the metal frame. Carefully feed the air valve through the hole  in the rim before removing, or you could tear a larger hole in the tire.

Lines.Text: reach inside the tire and remove the tube from the metal frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Reach inside the tire and remove the tube from the metal frame.

Lines.Text: before replacing the tube , feel along the tire to check for and remove any objects stuck in the tire .
line up the air valve on the new ( partially deflated ) tube with the hole on the metal frame .
working all around the tire , carefully push the tube back into place inside the tire .
finally , push the tire back into place on the metal frame and inflate the tire .
the tire should be inflated to 50 psi and very hard .

Steps.Text_raw: Before replacing the tube, feel along the tire to check for and remove any objects stuck in the tire. Line up the air valve on the new (partially deflated) tube with the hole on the metal frame. Working all around the tire, carefully push the tube back into place inside the tire. Finally, push the tire back into place on the metal frame and inflate the tire. The tire should be inflated to 50 psi and very hard.

Lines.Text: insert the axle bolt into center of rear wheel .
insert the wheel with the axle bolt into the lower back of the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the axle bolt into center of rear wheel. Insert the wheel with the axle bolt into the lower back of the frame.

Lines.Text: screw the bolt on the outside of the wheel with a 19 mm socket wrench .
screw the nut on the inside of the wheel with a 19 mm wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Screw the bolt on the outside of the wheel with a 19 mm socket wrench. Screw the nut on the inside of the wheel with a 19 mm wrench.

Title: Repairing GEN 2 Wheelchair Patching a Tire Tube

Lines.Text: unscrew the axle nut with a 19 mm wrench .
unscrew the the axle bolt with a 19 mm socket wrench .
remove the wheel from the wheelchair .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the axle nut with a 19 mm wrench. Unscrew the the axle bolt with a 19 mm socket wrench. Remove the wheel from the wheelchair.

Lines.Text: insert the 19 mm socket wrench between the rubber tire and the metal frame .
any rigid flat metal object can be used for this step .
carefully slide the 19 mm socket wrench all the way around the tire . bend the wrench down to pop the tire out of the bead of the rim .
when undoing the tire , be careful using the back of the wrench because the tool can damage the tire tube and or wheel frame .
reach inside the tire and remove the tube from the metal frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the 19 mm socket wrench between the rubber tire and the metal frame. Any rigid flat metal object can be used for this step. Carefully slide the 19 mm socket wrench all the way around the tire. Bend the wrench down to pop the tire out of the bead of the rim. When undoing the tire, be careful using the back of the wrench because the tool can damage the tire tube and or wheel frame. Reach inside the tire and remove the tube from the metal frame.

Lines.Text: take the inner tube from inside the tire and submerge the tube in water .
squeeze the tube gently looking for bubbles from the tube in the water .
you can use where the bubbles are forming to locate the hole in the tube .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the inner tube from inside the tire and submerge the tube in water. Squeeze the tube gently looking for bubbles from the tube in the water. You can use where the bubbles are forming to locate the hole in the tube.

Lines.Text: dry off the tube .
pull the tube out of the water and mark the location of the hole on the tube so that it can be found again .

Steps.Text_raw: Dry off the tube. Pull the tube out of the water and mark the location of the hole on the tube so that it can be found again.

Lines.Text: use sand paper to texturize the tire tube .
wipe off any excess rubber that was sanded off the tube .

Steps.Text_raw: Use sand paper to texturize the tire tube. Wipe off any excess rubber that was sanded off the tube.

Lines.Text: apply a thin layer of rubber cement over the area that was marked .
the layer should be slightly bigger than the size of the hole .
let the rubber cement set for 5 minutes .
peel the patch off of the plastic backing .
place patch over the area with the rubber cement and firmly press down until the patch is securely attached .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply a thin layer of rubber cement over the area that was marked. The layer should be slightly bigger than the size of the hole. Let the rubber cement set for 5 minutes. Peel the patch off of the plastic backing. Place patch over the area with the rubber cement and firmly press down until the patch is securely attached.

Lines.Text: feel along the tire to check for and remove any objects stuck in the tire before replacing the tube .
line up the air valve on the newly patched ( partially deflated ) tube with the hole on the metal frame before trying to insert the tube .
working all around the tire , carefully push the tube back into place inside the tire .

Steps.Text_raw: Feel along the tire to check for and remove any objects stuck in the tire before replacing the tube. Line up the air valve on the newly patched (partially deflated) tube with the hole on the metal frame before trying to insert the tube. Working all around the tire, carefully push the tube back into place inside the tire.

Lines.Text: inflate the tire to 50 psi . if there is no gauge , inflate the tire until the tire is hard .

Steps.Text_raw: Inflate the tire to 50 psi. If there is no gauge, inflate the tire until the tire is hard.

Lines.Text: insert the axle bolt into the center of the rear wheel .
insert the wheel with the axle bolt into the lower back of the frame by screwing in the bolt .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the axle bolt into the center of the rear wheel. Insert the wheel with the axle bolt into the lower back of the frame by screwing in the bolt.

Lines.Text: secure the nut on the opposite side of the axle bolt and wheel . tighten with 1 /2 in or 19 mm wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Secure the nut on the opposite side of the axle bolt and wheel. Tighten with 1/2 in or 19 mm wrench.

Title: How to fix GEN 2 Wheelchair squeaky parts

Lines.Text: locate the source of the squeaking .
typically , this will be one of the rear wheels , castor wheels , or brakes .
clean and remove any dirt or rust from the source of the squeaking .
you may need to partially disassemble the squeaky part in order to thoroughly clean it .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the source of the squeaking. Typically, this will be one of the rear wheels, castor wheels, or brakes. Clean and remove any dirt or rust from the source of the squeaking. You may need to partially disassemble the squeaky part in order to thoroughly clean it.

Lines.Text: check for improper assembly .
refer to the teardown to check that the wheelchair is properly assembled .
check for proper lubrication . if not lubricated , lubricate thoroughly with bike grease .

Steps.Text_raw: Check for improper assembly. Refer to the teardown to check that the wheelchair is properly assembled. Check for proper lubrication. If not lubricated, lubricate thoroughly with bike grease.

Lines.Text: roll the wheelchair around to check if the squeaking has stopped .
if the squeaking still continues , recheck the chair until the problem is fixed .

Steps.Text_raw: Roll the wheelchair around to check if the squeaking has stopped. If the squeaking still continues, recheck the chair until the problem is fixed.

Title: Free Wheelchair Mission GEN 1 Lawn Chair Replacement

Lines.Text: locate the four straps on each corner of the cushion .
untie each of the straps and remove the cushion from the chair .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the four straps on each corner of the cushion. Untie each of the straps and remove the cushion from the chair.

Lines.Text: turn the chair around and locate the two base plates that hold the axle to the back of the chair .
there are two screws on each of the plates that connect the chair to the axle .
hold the nut with the pliers . in the other hand , use the 10 mm wrench to remove the screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the chair around and locate the two base plates that hold the axle to the back of the chair. There are two screws on each of the plates that connect the chair to the axle. Hold the nut with the pliers. In the other hand, use the 10mm wrench to remove the screw.

Lines.Text: remove both of the screws from each of the axle plates to free the chair from the axle .
make sure too keep track of which bolts belong to certain parts of the wheelchair . you do not want to loose track of where each bolt belongs .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove both of the screws from each of the axle plates to free the chair from the axle. Make sure too keep track of which bolts belong to certain parts of the wheelchair. You do not want to loose track of where each bolt belongs.

Lines.Text: locate both of the brakes . they are each located on the front of the chair between the rear tire and the frame .
there are two screws connecting each of the brakes to the frame .
remove both of the screws from the frame using the 10 mm wrench and pair of pliers .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate both of the brakes. They are each located on the front of the chair between the rear tire and the frame. There are two screws connecting each of the brakes to the frame. Remove both of the screws from the frame using the 10mm wrench and pair of pliers.

Lines.Text: remove the brakes from the frame .
repeat with the brake on the other side of the wheelchair .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the brakes from the frame. Repeat with the brake on the other side of the wheelchair.

Lines.Text: locate the screws that hold the back frame , chair , castor wheel , and front frame together .
there is one screw on each side of the chair immediately above where the brakes are located .
remove both of these screws using the 10 mm wrench and a pair of pliers .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the screws that hold the back frame, chair, castor wheel, and front frame together. There is one screw on each side of the chair immediately above where the brakes are located. Remove both of these screws using the 10mm wrench and a pair of pliers.

Lines.Text: remove the front frame and each of the castor wheels from the wheelchair .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the front frame and each of the castor wheels from the wheelchair.

Lines.Text: remove the lawn chair from the back frame by lifting it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the lawn chair from the back frame by lifting it up.

Subject: Lawn Chair

Title: Free Wheelchair Mission GEN 1 Rear Wheel Axle Replacement

Lines.Text: attach the 19 mm socket wrench to the head of the bolt in the middle of the wheel
with the other hand use the 19 mm crescent wrench to hold the nut in place
while holding the 19 mm crescent wrench in place , use socket wrench to unscrew the bolt
the free wheelchair mission multi-purpose tool can be used in place of the 19 mm socket wrench
remove the wheel from the axle

Steps.Text_raw: Attach the 19mm socket wrench to the head of the bolt in the middle of the wheel With the other hand use the 19mm crescent wrench to hold the nut in place While holding the 19mm crescent wrench in place, use socket wrench to unscrew the bolt The Free Wheelchair Mission Multi-Purpose Tool can be used in place of the 19mm socket wrench Remove the wheel from the axle

Lines.Text: unscrew the nut holding the bolt and wheel together using your hands .
it might be necessary to loosen the nut with a 19 mm crescent wrench and the multi purpose tool
repeat step on other wheel
make sure to keep all corresponding nuts and bolts together to prevent mixup when reassembling the axle

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the nut holding the bolt and wheel together using your hands. It might be necessary to loosen the nut with a 19 mm crescent wrench and the multi purpose tool Repeat step on other wheel Make sure to keep all corresponding nuts and bolts together to prevent mixup when reassembling the axle

Lines.Text: locate the two baseplates on the back of the wheelchair holding the axle in place

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two baseplates on the back of the wheelchair holding the axle in place

Lines.Text: using the pliers to hold the bolt in place , use the 10 mm wrench to remove one bolt from the baseplate .
repeat above step on second bolt
repeat the process on the other baseplate , once one baseplate is loose from the chair and frame ,

Steps.Text_raw: Using the pliers to hold the bolt in place, use the 10mm wrench to remove one bolt from the baseplate. Repeat above step on second bolt Repeat the process on the other baseplate, once one baseplate is loose from the chair and frame,

Lines.Text: once both baseplates are loosened from the chair , pull the axle off from the wheelchair
the axle should come off easily
slide the baseplates off of the axle

Steps.Text_raw: Once both baseplates are loosened from the chair, pull the axle off from the wheelchair The axle should come off easily Slide the baseplates off of the axle

Subject: Rear Wheel Axle

Title: Free Wheelchair Mission GEN 1 Wheelchair Castor Wheel Replacement

Lines.Text: use the socket head of the 19 mm wrench to unscrew the nut that connects the castor wheels fork to the steel frame
remove the wheel from the small steel frame

Steps.Text_raw: Use the socket head of the 19mm wrench to unscrew the nut that connects the castor wheel’s fork to the steel frame Remove the wheel from the small steel frame

Lines.Text: hold the bolt that connects the wheel to the fork with pliers
this keeps the bolt through the wheel from rotating
use the socket head of the 10 mm wrench in your other hand to remove the nut on the other end of the bolt

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the bolt that connects the wheel to the fork with pliers This keeps the bolt through the wheel from rotating Use the socket head of the 10 mm wrench in your other hand to remove the nut on the other end of the bolt

Lines.Text: flip wheel over and remove the bolt
remove the castor wheel

Steps.Text_raw: Flip wheel over and remove the bolt Remove the castor wheel

Lines.Text: check for and remove any debris from the wheel or wheel axle that may be obstructing motion of the wheel

Steps.Text_raw: Check for and remove any debris from the wheel or wheel axle that may be obstructing motion of the wheel

Subject: Castor Wheels

Lines.Text: fit the lawn chair with the main frame by aligning the back of the lawn chair with the frame
the chair should fit in easily
make sure the rear legs of the lawn chair are inside the frame and the back of front legs line up with the holes on the front of the frame

Steps.Text_raw: Fit the lawn chair with the main frame by aligning the back of the lawn chair with the frame The chair should fit in easily Make sure the rear legs of the lawn chair are inside the frame and the back of front legs line up with the holes on the front of the frame

Lines.Text: line up one of the castor wheels with the holes on the front legs of the wheelchair and align the front frame with the castor wheels
make sure the guide knob on the castor wheel faces forward and the front frame fits perfectly with the guide knob
insert one long bolt through the top-most hole connecting the front frame , castor wheel , lawn chair , and main frame
using pliers and the 10 mm wrench , securely fasten a nut to the bolt and repeat on the other side

Steps.Text_raw: Line up one of the castor wheels with the holes on the front legs of the wheelchair and align the front frame with the castor wheels Make sure the guide knob on the castor wheel faces forward and the front frame fits perfectly with the guide knob Insert one long bolt through the top-most hole connecting the front frame, castor wheel, lawn chair, and main frame Using pliers and the 10mm wrench, securely fasten a nut to the bolt and repeat on the other side

Lines.Text: slide both of the axle plates onto the axle
position each of the plates on the inside of each of the lawn chair legs
attach both of the plates to the chair by screwing in two screws to to each plate
use the pliers to hold the nut while screwing in the screw with a 10 mm wrench

Steps.Text_raw: Slide both of the axle plates onto the axle Position each of the plates on the  inside of each of the lawn chair legs Attach both of the plates to the chair by screwing in two screws to to each plate Use the pliers to hold the nut while screwing in the screw with a 10mm wrench

Lines.Text: slide the 19 mm axle bolt into one of the rear wheels and then hand-tighten the nut onto the bolt
insert the bolt into the axle so that the wheel is attached to the side of the frame
use the 19 mm crescent wrench to hold the nut in place and use the socket wrench ( or multi-purpose tool ) to screw the axle into the frame

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the 19mm axle bolt into one of the rear wheels and then hand-tighten the nut onto the bolt Insert the bolt into the axle so that the wheel is attached to the side of the frame Use the 19mm crescent wrench to hold the nut in place and use the socket wrench (or multi-purpose tool) to screw the axle into the frame

Lines.Text: locate the both of the brakes and the four long screws
place the brake behind the front frame right above the castor wheels
the brake with the yellow nob goes on the right side of the chair , and the brake with the black nob goes on the left
screw both of the screws into the bottom two holes in the frame using a 10 mm wrench to hold the nut and the t-wrench to fasten the screws
you can use a power drill instead of a t-wrench to speed up the process

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the both of the brakes and the four long screws Place the brake behind the front frame right above the castor wheels The brake with the yellow nob goes on the right side of the chair, and the brake with the black nob goes on the left Screw both of the screws into the bottom two holes in the frame using a 10mm wrench to hold the nut and the T-Wrench to fasten the screws You can use a power drill instead of a T-Wrench to speed up the process

Lines.Text: position the extendable footrest bar to the front frame at the desired height
make sure the two bolt holes on the footrest bar line up with two of the holes on the front frame
pick the suitable position for the footrest that will complement the recipient ( the position may be changed later )
using the 10 mm wrench , secure the footrest bar to the front frame using the a flat-head bolt and nut pointing in towards the center of the wheelchair
attach the footrest to the footrest bar with the bottom of the footrest pointing upwards
match the footrest wedges up with the holes and attach the footrest to the front frame using 4 small bolts and tighten 4 small nuts onto the bolts using the 10 mm wrench
the heads of the bolts should fit perfectly through the footrest

Steps.Text_raw: Position the extendable footrest bar to the front frame at the desired height Make sure the two bolt holes on the footrest bar line up with two of the holes on the front frame Pick the suitable position for the footrest that will complement the recipient (the position may be changed later) Using the 10mm wrench, secure the footrest bar to the front frame using the a flat-head bolt and nut pointing in towards the center of the wheelchair Attach the footrest to the footrest bar with the bottom of the footrest pointing upwards Match the footrest wedges up with the holes and attach the footrest to the front frame using 4 small bolts and tighten 4 small nuts onto the bolts using the 10mm wrench The heads of the bolts should fit perfectly through the footrest

Lines.Text: place the cushion on top of the lawn chair seat and tie each of the 4 straps to the edge of the chair

Steps.Text_raw: Place the cushion on top of the lawn chair seat and tie each of the 4 straps to the edge of the chair

Lines.Text: using the final bolt and rounded nut , attach the hand pump to the back right side of the main frame next to the right rear wheel
secure the hand pump to frame using the 10 mm wrench

Steps.Text_raw: Using the final bolt and rounded nut, attach the hand pump to the back right side of the main frame next to the right rear wheel Secure the hand pump to frame using the 10mm wrench

Title: How to Free Wheelchair Mission GEN 1

Toolbox.Name: free wheelchair mission custom multi-purpose tool

Lines.Text: unscrew the axle bolt using the free wheelchair mission custom multi-purpose tool on the bolt head and a 19 mm crescent wrench on the nut .
remove the wheel and set it aside .
you can also use a 19 mm socket instead of the multitool .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the axle bolt Using the Free Wheelchair Mission Custom Multi-Purpose Tool on the bolt head and a 19mm crescent wrench on the nut. Remove the wheel and set it aside. You can also use a 19mm socket instead of the multitool.
Tools_extracted: free wheelchair mission custom multi-purpose tool

Lines.Text: unscrew the cap of the tube stem and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the cap of the tube stem and set it aside.

Lines.Text: release any air that remains by pressing down on the piston in the head of the stem .

Steps.Text_raw: Release any air that remains by pressing down on the piston in the head of the stem.

Lines.Text: take a tire lever and fit it under the edge of the tire .
pop the edge of the tire out of the rim of the wheel by pushing down on the lever .
clip the opposite end of the lever onto the closest spoke .

Steps.Text_raw: Take a tire lever and fit it under the edge of the tire. Pop the edge of the tire out of the rim of the wheel by pushing down on the lever. Clip the opposite end of the lever onto the closest spoke.

Lines.Text: take another tire lever and repeat step 4 roughly 2.5 inches away from where you are holding the other tire lever .

Steps.Text_raw: Take another tire lever and repeat step 4 roughly 2.5 inches away from where you are holding the other tire lever.

Lines.Text: holding one tire lever in place , slide the other lever around the rest of the wheel until the side of the tire is completely free of the rim .

Steps.Text_raw: Holding one tire lever in place, slide the other lever around the rest of the wheel until the side of the tire is completely free of the rim.

Lines.Text: push the stem of the tube back through the hole in the rim it comes out of .
reach under the tire and pull the tube out .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the stem of the tube back through the hole in the rim it comes out of. Reach under the tire and pull the tube out.

Lines.Text: unfold the new tube and unscrew the cap of the stem .
set the cap aside someplace safe . you will need to put it back on later .

Steps.Text_raw: Unfold the new tube and unscrew the cap of the stem. Set the cap aside someplace safe. You will need to put it back on later.

Lines.Text: fit the stem of the tube firmly into the hole in the pump that comes on the frame .
lift the lever on the head of the pump up .

Steps.Text_raw: Fit the stem of the tube firmly into the hole in the pump that comes on the frame. Lift the lever on the head of the pump up.

Lines.Text: pull the handle of the piston at the bottom of the pump out .
pump a small amount of air into the tube so that it holds its basic shape .
to pump air into the tube pull the piston out then push it back in .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the handle of the piston at the bottom of the pump out. Pump a small amount of air into the tube so that it holds its basic shape. To pump air into the tube pull the piston out then push it back in.

Lines.Text: push the stem of the tube through the hole in the rim so that the head is on the outside .
push the rest of the tube under the tire so it sits evenly on the rim .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the stem of the tube through the hole in the rim so that the head is on the outside. Push the rest of the tube under the tire so it sits evenly on the rim.

Lines.Text: push the tire back onto the rim working your hands around the wheel .
pump air into the tube until the tire is firm and can support you weight .
screw the cap back onto the head of the tube stem .
if you have a pressure gauge it should read around 40 psi .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the tire back onto the rim working your hands around the wheel. Pump air into the tube until the tire is firm and can support you weight. Screw the cap back onto the head of the tube stem. If you have a pressure gauge it should read around 40 psi.

Lines.Text: put the wheel back on the axle and screw in the bolt using the multitool or 19 mm socket and 19 mm crescent wrench .
make sure the handle faces out .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the wheel back on the axle and screw in the bolt using the multitool or 19mm socket and 19mm crescent wrench. Make sure the handle faces out.

Lines.Text: turn bike upside down as shown

Steps.Text_raw: Turn bike upside down as shown

Lines.Text: use a wrench to loosen the nut holding the wheel's axle on one side .
once it's loose enough , continue removing the nut with your hand .
after removing the nut , also remove the washer under it .
note how the washer has a small appendage that locks into a slot in the fork .

Lines.Text: unscrew cap from air valve .
use a thin object to press down the pin in the center of the valve , releasing the air in the tire .
note : we use a hex wrench in this picture , but you can use pretty much any blunt object that fits .

Lines.Text: take a tire lever , and wedge it between the tire and the rim . make sure the end scoops inward to grab the tire .
once you manage to grab the edge of the tire with the lever , pull the lever back to scoop the tire out of the rim .
then , use the notch in the other end of the lever to keep it steadily anchored on a nearby spoke .

then , leapfrog the second and third levers until the tire comes partway off .

as you do this , make sure you pull the air valve out through its hole in the rim .
now , the tire ( with the tube inside ) should be completely removed from the rim .

be sure to pull gently , because sometimes the tube can sometimes end up adhered to the inside of the tire .

Lines.Text: loosen the bolt that secures your seat .
to do so , use one wrench to hold the larger nut on the left side of the bike still while you loosen the nut on the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the bolt that secures your seat. To do so, use one wrench to hold the larger nut on the left side of the bike still while you loosen the nut on the right.

Lines.Text: now that it can move , move the seat by wiggling it and pulling it in the direction you want to adjust it .
you want to the adjust the seat so that , when a pedal is at the far end of its rotation , your leg is fully extended .
don't worry about getting it perfect on the first try . instead , guess your adjustment , tighten the bolt a little bit , try it out , and adjust again until you get it right .

Lines.Text: once your seat is at the desired height , you just tighten the bolt the same way you loosened it .
use two wrenches , one to hold it still and the other to tighten the nut .
make sure it's very tight , or else the seat might twist or lower over time .

Title: How to adjust Nishiki Aero II Brake Cable Tension

Lines.Text: use the two wrenches to loosen the nut that holds the brake cable to the braking mechanism .
you might want to enlist a friend to hold on to the end of the cable for you so it doesn't fall off when you loosen the nut that holds it down .

note : in this picture we use pliers and an adjustable crescent wrench in place of the 9 mm wrenches that would be ideal for that bolt . however , anything that can turn the bolt should work just fine .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the two wrenches to loosen the nut that holds the brake cable to the braking mechanism. You might want to enlist a friend to hold on to the end of the cable for you so it doesn't fall off when you loosen the nut that holds it down. Note: In this picture we use pliers and an adjustable crescent wrench in place of the 9mm wrenches that would be ideal for that bolt. However, anything that can turn the bolt should work just fine.

Lines.Text: now that the nut is loosened , pull the cable tighter or looser to adjust the resting state of the brake clamp .
adjust the tension so that the brake pads are about 1 to 2 mm from the rim of the wheel .
when you are done , ''firmly'' tighten the nut that you loosened in the previous step .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that the nut is loosened, pull the cable tighter or looser to adjust the resting state of the brake clamp. Adjust the tension so that the brake pads are about 1 to 2 mm from the rim of the wheel. When you are done, ''firmly'' tighten the nut that you loosened in the previous step.

Lines.Text: afterwards , you can fine-tune the adjustment by tightening or loosening the barrel adjuster located about 7 inches above the brake levers .

Steps.Text_raw: Afterwards, you can fine-tune the adjustment by tightening or loosening the barrel adjuster located about 7 inches above the brake levers.

Lines.Text: first , remove the front wheel from the frame by unscrewing the adjustable screw

Steps.Text_raw: First, remove the front wheel from the frame by unscrewing the adjustable screw

Lines.Text: next , wedge tire tool below the bike wheel , right above the rim .
once firmly in place , push the tire tool down towards the ground in order to create spacing between the tire and the rim .
following this , grab the 2nd tire tool and place it into the gap you have created .
slide the 2nd tool around the entire circumference of the tire , while holding the first in place , in order to dislodge the tire from the rim .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, wedge tire tool below the bike wheel, right above the rim. Once firmly in place, push the tire tool down towards the ground in order to create spacing between the tire and the rim. Following this, grab the 2nd tire tool and place it into the gap you have created. Slide the 2nd tool around the entire circumference of the tire, while holding the first in place, in order to dislodge the tire from the rim.

Lines.Text: after removing the bike tire , locate the bike valve used to pump air into the tire .
gently remove the inner tube starting with the area around the valve .
make a note of where the hole for the valve is located on the bike rim , because that is where the next step begins .

Steps.Text_raw: After removing the bike tire, locate the bike valve used to pump air into the tire. Gently remove the inner tube starting with the area around the valve. Make a note of where the hole for the valve is located on the bike rim, because that is where the next step begins.

Lines.Text: pump a small amount of air into the new bike tube so that it is easier to work with .
next , locate the hole in the bike rim and feed the valve through and into position .
next , wrap the rest of the tubing over the rim comfortably , while making sure that no folds or creases form on the tube .

Steps.Text_raw: Pump a small amount of air into the new bike tube so that it is easier to work with. Next, locate the hole in the bike rim and feed the valve through and into position. Next, wrap the rest of the tubing over the rim comfortably, while making sure that no folds or creases form on the tube.

Lines.Text: finish by placing the bike tire back on the the frame , while making sure that no fold or creases form in the tube .
lastly , pump air into the tire and remount onto bike frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Finish by placing the bike tire back on the the frame, while making sure that no fold or creases form in the tube. Lastly, pump air into the tire and remount onto bike frame.

make sure that the chain is on the correct side of the wheel

Lines.Text: tighten brake strap using screwdriver and 10 mm socket wrench . hold the nut on the inside ( near the spokes ) with wrench as you tighten the screw with the screwdriver .

wheel will angle as you tighten . keep it centered with your hand as you finish tightening both axle nuts .

Title: How to remove and clean Arbor Rally Longboard bearings

Lines.Text: use the half inch wrench to remove the nut on each wheel . then remove each wheel .
be careful not to lose the washers that sit between the nut and wheel , they are small and hard to find after you lose them .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the half inch wrench to remove the nut on each wheel. Then remove each wheel. Be careful not to lose the washers that sit between the nut and wheel, they are small and hard to find after you lose them.

Lines.Text: use needle nose pliers to remove the bearings from both sides of each wheel .

Steps.Text_raw: Use needle nose pliers to remove the bearings from both sides of each wheel.

Lines.Text: place the bearings in soapy water and let them soak for 5 minutes .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the bearings in soapy water and let them soak for 5 minutes.

Lines.Text: wipe off the dirt from each bearing and dry them thoroughly with a paper towel .

Steps.Text_raw: Wipe off the dirt from each bearing and dry them thoroughly with a paper towel.

Lines.Text: apply a few drops of lubricant to the inner portion on both sides of each bearing .
spin the bearings and wipe off any extra lubricant that has not settled in .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply a few drops of lubricant to the inner portion on both sides of each bearing. Spin the bearings and wipe off any extra lubricant that has not settled in.

Lines.Text: push the bearing into the wheel by applying even pressure with your thumb .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the bearing into the wheel by applying even pressure with your thumb.

Lines.Text: spin the wheel to make sure that the bearings are properly aligned and running smoothly .

Steps.Text_raw: Spin the wheel to make sure that the bearings are properly aligned and running smoothly.

Lines.Text: place the wheel on the axle followed by washer and then the nut .
tighten the nut with your fingers as much as you can first and then use the wrench to finish the job .
do not tighten the nut too much or else the wheel will not be able to spin . you should be able to slightly shake the wheel up and down along the axle .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the wheel on the axle followed by washer and then the nut. Tighten the nut with your fingers as much as you can first and then use the wrench to finish the job. Do not tighten the nut too much or else the wheel will not be able to spin. You should be able to slightly shake the wheel up and down along the axle.

Lines.Text: mount the light in between a 11 mm socket and 22 socket like so in a vice .

Steps.Text_raw: Mount the light in between a 11mm socket and 22 socket like so in a vice.

Lines.Text: slowly clamp , the clear light cover will push in . there is quite a lot of resistance .

Steps.Text_raw: Slowly clamp, the clear light cover will push in. There is quite a lot of resistance.

Lines.Text: keep on going until the resistance fades . the light cover will be depressed as shown . and the electronics will just fall out .

Steps.Text_raw: Keep on going until the resistance fades. The light cover will be depressed as shown. and the electronics will just fall out.

Lines.Text: you can see where the electronics slides into .

you can see how it is held in with friction from the raised plastic bevel . if you wish to make it easier to disassemble , file the friction bevel down . don't file down the keying semi circular bevel .
the last picture shows the plastic filed down .

Steps.Text_raw: You can see where the electronics slides into. You can see how it is held in with friction from the raised plastic bevel. If you wish to make it easier to disassemble, file the friction bevel down. Don't file down the keying semi circular bevel. The last picture shows the plastic filed down.

Title: How to adjust Triace A310 Brake Cable

Lines.Text: while holding onto the brake cable , unscrew the screw that holds the brake cable in place using a 5 mm allen wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: While holding onto the brake cable, unscrew the screw that holds the brake cable in place using a 5mm allen wrench.

Lines.Text: if you need to loosen your brakes , pull up on the arm while holding the brake cable in place .
to tighten your brakes follow the above step , except push down on the arm instead of pulling up .

Steps.Text_raw: If you need to loosen your brakes, pull up on the arm while holding the brake cable in place. To tighten your brakes follow the above step, except push down on the arm instead of pulling up.

Lines.Text: tighten the screw on the desired location along the cable with the same 5 mm allen wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Tighten the screw on the desired location along the cable with the same 5mm allen wrench.

Title: Tightening Mt. Fury Roadmaster Brake Cables

Lines.Text: loosen the bolt that clamps the brake cable on the brake caliper with the 10 mm open-end wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the bolt that clamps the brake cable on the brake caliper with the 10mm open-end wrench.

Lines.Text: pull the brake cable until proper tension is acquired and the cable shows resistance .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the brake cable until proper tension is acquired and the cable shows resistance.

Lines.Text: re-tighten the clamping nut .

Steps.Text_raw: Re-tighten the clamping nut.

Lines.Text: if necessary , adjust the positioning of the caliper arms by loosening the dome nut at the pivot point and manually shifting the arms in the desired direction .

Steps.Text_raw: If necessary, adjust the positioning of the caliper arms by loosening the dome nut at the pivot point and manually shifting the arms in the desired direction.

Lines.Text: for more precise adjustment of the brake cable tension , use pliers to tighten the barrel nut at the opposite ends of the handlebars on the brake levers .

Steps.Text_raw: For more precise adjustment of the brake cable tension, use pliers to tighten the barrel nut at the opposite ends of the handlebars on the brake levers.

Title: Timbuk2 Pannier Whole Clip Bracket Replacement

Lines.Text: here are the tools you will need :
standard screwdriver
new pannier whole clip bracket
wrench

Steps.Text_raw: Here are the tools you will need: Standard Screwdriver New Pannier Whole Clip Bracket Wrench

Lines.Text: to remove clip bracket , first remove all 3 clips using the 2 screwdriver or hand drill ( make sure to put clips and their screws and anchor plates in a safe place as to not misplace any such as a ziploc bag ) .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove clip bracket, first remove all 3 clips using the #2 screwdriver or hand drill (Make sure to put clips and their screws and anchor plates in a safe place as to not misplace any such as a Ziploc bag).

Lines.Text: unscrew all 13 small black screws . to do so , undo velcro flap located at the top of the laptop sleeve . with the wrench , hold nut in place in the back of the pannier .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew all 13 small black screws. To do so, undo velcro flap located at the top of the laptop sleeve. With the wrench, hold nut in place in the back of the pannier.

Lines.Text: while holding nuts with the wrench , use the screwdriver to unscrew the screw in the front bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: While holding nuts with the wrench, use the screwdriver to unscrew the screw in the front bracket.

Lines.Text: remove old clip . take new clip bracket and unscrew and remove middle clip .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove old clip. Take new clip bracket and unscrew and remove middle clip.

Lines.Text: replace the middle clip and screw it into place on the bag . place the new clip bracket in place and screw in all 13 screws again .
as in step 3 and 4 , hold nut with wrench while screwing clip in place . ( be sure to keep washers in between the screws and the body of the bag )

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the middle clip and screw it into place on the bag. Place the new clip bracket in place and screw in all 13 screws again. As in step 3 and 4, hold nut with wrench while screwing clip in place. (Be sure to keep washers in between the screws and the body of the bag)

Lines.Text: you're done !

Steps.Text_raw: You're done!

Title: Timbuk2 Pannier Bottom Stay Bracket Replacement

Lines.Text: tools needed :
new pannier bottom stay bracket .
standard screwdriver
wrench

Steps.Text_raw: Tools needed: New Pannier Bottom Stay Bracket. Standard Screwdriver Wrench

Lines.Text: to remove bottom stay bracket , first unscrew all 4 screws . to do so , undo velcro flap located at the top of the laptop sleeve . with the wrench , hold nut in place in the back of the pannier , while using the screwdriver to unscrew the screw in the front bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove bottom stay bracket, first unscrew all 4 screws. To do so, undo velcro flap located at the top of the laptop sleeve. With the wrench, hold nut in place in the back of the pannier, while using the screwdriver to unscrew the screw in the front bracket.

Lines.Text: remove old clip . take new bottom bracket and remove all screws and washers from bracket ( make sure to put all screws , washers , and nuts in a safe place ( ziploc bag ) as to not lose any ! )
follow step 2 in reverse order to attach new clip bracket . ( hold nut with wrench while screwing back in place . also make sure the washers are between the screws and the body of the bag . )

Steps.Text_raw: Remove old clip. Take new bottom bracket and remove all screws and washers from bracket (Make sure to put all screws, washers, and nuts in a safe place (Ziploc bag) as to not lose any!) Follow step 2 in reverse order to attach new clip bracket. (Hold nut with wrench while screwing back in place. Also make sure the washers are between the screws and the body of the bag.)

Lines.Text: all done !

Steps.Text_raw: All Done!
