Lines.Text: unscrew the six 11.2 mm phillips machine screws from the inside of the wheel .
you many need to spray a thin lubricant , such as pb blaster , directly onto each of the six screw points to loosen them .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the six 11.2 mm Phillips machine screws from the inside of the wheel. You many need to spray a thin lubricant, such as PB Blaster, directly onto each of the six screw points to loosen them.

Lines.Text: pull the wheel off of its base .
the wheel has a strong magnetic connection to the base , so separating the them will require a lot of force .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the wheel off of its base. The wheel has a strong magnetic connection to the base, so separating the them will require a lot of force.

Lines.Text: ensure that the swagtron is off .
turn the swagtron upside down to see the underside .

Steps.Text_raw: Ensure that the SwagTron is off. Turn the SwagTron upside down to see the underside.

Lines.Text: unscrew the eighteen 10 mm screws that secure the back panels using a phillips 2 screwdriver .
the screws are tightly in place . it will take effort to screw them out .
the panel is still attached to the swagtron by wires that go to the motherboard .
carefully lift the panels off

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the eighteen 10mm screws that secure the back panels using a Phillips #2 screwdriver. The screws are tightly in place. It will take effort to screw them out. The panel is still attached to the SwagTron by wires that go to the motherboard. Carefully lift the panels off

Lines.Text: follow the wires from the panels to the motherboard .
you may need to cut any zip ties that are holding the wires together .
there is one connection on the battery side and three on the other side that must be removed .
these connections may be difficult to remove . try to securely press the connection and pull firmly .
your back panels are now completely removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Follow the wires from the panels to the motherboard. You may need to cut any zip ties that are holding the wires together. There is one connection on the battery side and three on the other side that must be removed. These connections may be difficult to remove. Try to securely press the connection and pull firmly. Your back panels are now completely removed.

Lines.Text: using your phillips 2 screwdriver , remove the four 1cm screws that attach the gyroscope and its black case to the hoverboard .
carefully remove this component and set it off to the side .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your Phillips #2 screwdriver, remove the four 1cm screws that attach the gyroscope and its black case to the hoverboard. Carefully remove this component and set it off to the side.

Lines.Text: using your h 6.0 allen wrench , remove the four 20 mm black bolts shown in the picture .
take off the iron plate holding the wheel in place .
remove the motor/wheel and set it aside close by to the hoverboard .
the wires from the motor/wheel should still be connected to the motherboard .
these bolts are very tight , it may be difficult to remove them . try using a tool with a long handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your H 6.0 allen wrench, remove the four 20mm black bolts shown in the picture. Take off the iron plate holding the wheel in place. Remove the Motor/Wheel and set it aside close by to the hoverboard. The wires from the Motor/Wheel should still be connected to the motherboard. These bolts are very tight, it may be difficult to remove them. Try using a tool with a long handle.

Lines.Text: slide the protective plastic off the connectors on the marked wires ( green , blue , and yellow ) using your hands or a set of tweezers .
the connectors on the wires of your hoverboard may be different from those shown in the pictures on the left due to differences in manufacturing .
separate the set of marked green , blue , and yellow wires from their connectors .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the protective plastic off the connectors on the marked wires (green, blue, and yellow) using your hands or a set of tweezers. The connectors on the wires of your hoverboard may be different from those shown in the pictures on the left due to differences in manufacturing. Separate the set of marked green, blue, and yellow wires from their connectors.

Lines.Text: finally separate the last connector shown on the left .
your wheel is completely removed ; slide in a new motor/wheel into the slot and follow the previous steps in reverse order .
make sure the replacement wheel is snug . neither rubbing on the outer rim nor on the side of the hoverboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Finally separate the last connector shown on the left. Your wheel is completely removed; slide in a new Motor/Wheel into the slot and follow the previous steps in reverse order. Make sure the replacement wheel is snug. Neither rubbing on the outer rim nor on the side of the hoverboard.

Lines.Text: position the controller so the back is facing up .
use a t6 screwdriver to remove the six screws on the back of the controller : four 0.9 mm screws and two 0.1 mm screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Position the controller so the back is facing up. Use a T6 screwdriver to remove the six screws on the back of the controller: four 0.9 mm screws and two 0.1 mm screws.

Lines.Text: remove the foam adhesive that connects the front plate to the motherboard
the buttons ( l1 , r1 ) may fall out . set aside to replace during reassembly .
use a phillips 0 screwdriver to remove the two 0.7 mm screws highlighted .
remove the motherboard from the front plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the  foam adhesive that connects the front plate to the motherboard The buttons (L1,R1) may fall out. Set aside to replace during reassembly. Use a Philips #0 screwdriver to remove the two 0.7 mm screws highlighted. Remove the motherboard from the front plate.

Lines.Text: remove the buttons from the front plate of the fly pad and replace as needed .
hold the front plate of the fly pad facing downwards to prevent buttons from falling out .
make sure the text on buttons l1 and r1 correctly line up with l2 and r2 when reassembling the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the buttons from the front plate of the fly pad and replace as needed. Hold the front plate of the fly pad facing downwards to prevent buttons from falling out. Make sure the text on buttons L1 and R1 correctly line up with L2 and R2 when reassembling the device.

Lines.Text: total of 6 screws are located in the back of the controller .
four 0.9 mm t6 screws
two 0.1 mm t6 screws
flip the flypad over .
remove the six screws using a t6 screwdriver .
use a magnetic mat to prevent loss of screws . set aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Total of 6 Screws are located in the back of the controller. Four 0.9mm T6 screws Two 0.1mm T6 screws Flip the Flypad over. Remove the six screws using a T6 screwdriver. Use a Magnetic Mat to prevent loss of screws. Set aside.

Lines.Text: flip the flypad over again and separate the front and back . be sure to remove the foam adhesive that connects the front plate to the motherboard .
be aware that the buttons ( l1 , r1 ) may fall out . remember to put them back in place during reassembly .
use ph0 tool to remove the screws holding the motherboard in place .
gently remove the motherboard from the front plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the Flypad over again and separate the front and back. Be sure to remove the foam adhesive that connects the front plate to the motherboard. Be aware that the Buttons (L1,R1) may fall out. Remember to put them back in place during reassembly. Use Ph0 tool to remove the screws holding the motherboard in place. Gently remove the motherboard from the front plate.

Lines.Text: pop the joysticks out by pulling gently .

Steps.Text_raw: Pop the joysticks out by pulling gently.

Lines.Text: unscrew and replace joystick caps for a more comfortable grip .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew and replace joystick caps for a more comfortable grip.

Lines.Text: use a t6 screwdriver to remove the six screws from the back of the controller : four 0.9 mm screws and two 0.1 mm screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T6 screwdriver to remove the six screws from the back of the controller: four 0.9 mm screws and two 0.1 mm screws.

Lines.Text: use a screwdriver to remove the two 0.7 mm screws from the battery cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a screwdriver to remove the two 0.7 mm screws from the battery cover.

Lines.Text: separate the plastic cover from battery .
avoid damaging the wires and gently remove the battery from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the plastic cover from battery. Avoid damaging the wires and gently remove the battery from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: use fingers to gently detach the battery wires from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Use fingers to gently detach the battery wires from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: gently attach the wire connection from the new battery to the motherboard . avoid touching the motherboard directly .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently attach the wire connection from the new battery to the motherboard. Avoid touching the motherboard directly.

Lines.Text: undo the brake cables holding the brake calipers under tension .
depress the brake/shift levers ( brifters ) and insert a 5 mm allen key into the internal bolt . this bolt secures the brifters to the handlebar .
with the 5 mm allen key , loosen and temporarily remove brifters .

Steps.Text_raw: Undo the brake cables holding the brake calipers under tension. Depress the brake/shift levers (brifters) and insert a 5mm Allen key into the internal bolt. This bolt secures the brifters to the handlebar. With the 5mm Allen key, loosen and temporarily remove brifters.

Lines.Text: remove the old tape and discard .
pour some rubbing alcohol on the rag and clean any old adhesive residue off the handlebar .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the old tape and discard. Pour some rubbing alcohol on the rag and clean any old adhesive residue off the handlebar.

Lines.Text: starting on the right side of the handlebar , wrap the new tape around the end in a clockwise direction moving inward .
be sure to wrap the tape tight , but don't pull so hard that it rips !
using the scissors , cut the tape at an angle towards the outside of the bar .
wrap the loose end with either electrical tape or the adhesive piece provided with the handlebar tape ( pictured here )

Steps.Text_raw: Starting on the right side of the  handlebar, wrap the new tape around the end in a clockwise direction moving inward. Be sure to wrap the tape tight, but don't pull so hard that it rips! Using the scissors, cut the tape at an angle towards the outside of the bar. Wrap the loose end with either electrical tape or the adhesive piece provided with the handlebar tape (pictured here)

Lines.Text: on the left side of the handlebar , wrap the tape around the end in a counter-clockwise direction moving inward .
wrap tight , but don't rip !
using the scissors , cut the tape at an angle towards the outside of the bar .
wrap the loose end with either electrical tape or the adhesive piece provided with the handlebar tape ( pictured ) .

Steps.Text_raw: On the left side of the  handlebar, wrap the tape around the end in a counter-clockwise direction moving inward. Wrap tight, but don't rip! Using the scissors, cut the tape at an angle towards the outside of the bar. Wrap the loose end with either electrical tape or the adhesive piece provided with the handlebar tape (pictured).

Lines.Text: using the 5 mm allen key , reattach and tighten the brifter levers onto the handlebar .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 5mm Allen key, reattach and tighten the brifter levers onto the handlebar.

Lines.Text: reattach the brake cables to the brifters and brake calipers
depress the brake levers a couple of times to test and confirm that the cables were reinstalled properly before riding .

Steps.Text_raw: Reattach the brake cables to the brifters and brake calipers Depress the brake levers a couple of times to test and confirm that the cables were reinstalled properly before riding.

Title: How to Fix Bicycle Foam Handlebar Grips

Lines.Text: assess the problem area on your bike's handlebars .

Steps.Text_raw: Assess the problem area on your bike's handlebars.

Lines.Text: lightly sand down the handlebar with the sandpaper .
continue to sand the handlebar until no more residue falls .

Steps.Text_raw: Lightly sand down the handlebar with the sandpaper. Continue to sand the handlebar until no more residue falls.

Lines.Text: boil water in a pot .
once the water reaches boiling temperature ( 212 f/100 c ) , dip a rag into the water .
be careful when handling the rag after it has been taken out of the boiling water . handling the rag too quickly can result in a burn .
take the soaked rag and begin cleaning the handlebar by applying pressure and rubbing in a downwards motion .

Steps.Text_raw: Boil water in a pot. Once the water reaches boiling temperature (212°F/100°C), dip a rag into the water. Be careful when handling the rag after it has been taken out of the boiling water. Handling the rag too quickly can result in a burn. Take the soaked rag and begin cleaning the handlebar by applying pressure and rubbing in a downwards motion.

Lines.Text: press a new , clean rag tightly to the opening of the alcohol bottle .
tip the bottle upside down quickly and soak the rag with the alcohol .
once the rag is soaked , start cleaning the handlebar again . continue to clean the handlebar until there is no more visible residue coming off .

Steps.Text_raw: Press a new, clean rag tightly to the opening of the alcohol bottle. Tip the bottle upside down quickly and soak the rag with the alcohol. Once the rag is soaked, start cleaning the handlebar again. Continue to clean the handlebar until there is no more visible residue coming off.

Lines.Text: finally , bring the water to a boil once more .
dip a rag into the water and begin rubbing the handlebar for the last time . clean vigorously until the handlebar is noticeably smoother and no longer crumbling with residue .

Steps.Text_raw: Finally, bring the water to a boil once more. Dip a rag into the water and begin rubbing the handlebar for the last time. Clean vigorously until the handlebar is noticeably smoother and no longer crumbling with residue.

Lines.Text: push down and twist the propellers counter-clockwise to release from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Push down and twist the propellers counter-clockwise to release from the drone.

Lines.Text: firmly press the battery tabs on top and bottom of the battery and slide out the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly press the battery tabs on top and bottom of the battery and slide out the battery.

Lines.Text: if gimbal lock is still on , remove it from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: If gimbal lock is still on, remove it from the drone.

Lines.Text: using a t8 screwdriver , remove the eight torx screws from the plastic shell .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a T8 screwdriver, remove the eight Torx screws from the plastic shell.

Lines.Text: using a t6 screwdriver , remove all eight screws on the grey gimbal assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a T6 screwdriver, remove all eight screws on the grey gimbal assembly.

Lines.Text: using a plastic spudger or pick , gently pry the gimbal assembly from the drone .
do not try to pull the gimbal assembly away from drone just yetthere are cables that must be unplugged first .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a plastic spudger or pick, gently pry the gimbal assembly from the drone. Do not try to pull the gimbal assembly away from drone just yet—there are cables that must be unplugged first.

Lines.Text: using a phillips 000 screwdriver , remove the two screws and the gimbal bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips #000 screwdriver, remove the two screws and the gimbal bracket.

Lines.Text: using your fingers or needle-nose pliers , gently unplug the left ( red box ) cable by pushing in the white clips on the sides and sliding the cable out .
using a spudger , unplug the 3-in-1 cable on the right ( orange box ) by gently prying up .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your fingers or needle-nose pliers, gently unplug the left (red box) cable by pushing in the white clips on the sides and sliding the cable out. Using a spudger, unplug the 3-in-1 cable on the right (orange box) by gently prying up.

Lines.Text: using a phillips 000 screwdriver , remove the two screws and the antenna bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips #000 screwdriver, remove the two screws and the antenna bracket.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , gently disconnect the four antenna cables .
remember the order in which the antenna cables are plugged in , or refer to this step during reassembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, gently disconnect the four antenna cables. Remember the order in which the antenna cables are plugged in, or refer to this step during reassembly.

Lines.Text: using a phillips 000 screwdriver , remove the two screws located on the white plastic tabs .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips #000 screwdriver, remove the two screws located on the white plastic tabs.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , carefully bend the two metal clips upwards .
be gentle and do not break the clips . you will need to bend them back down upon reassembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, carefully bend the two metal clips upwards. Be gentle and do not break the clips. You will need to bend them back down upon reassembly.

Lines.Text: using a spudger or flathead screwdriver , gently pry up the led cover .
using a spudger or flathead screwdriver , carefully pry up the underlying sticker .
pro tip : stick the sticker to the smooth side of the plastic led cover to keep it clean and from losing stick .
repeat this step on all four led covers .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger or flathead screwdriver, gently pry up the LED cover. Using a spudger or flathead screwdriver, carefully pry up the underlying sticker. PRO TIP:  Stick the sticker to the smooth side of the plastic LED cover to keep it clean and from losing stick. Repeat this step on all four LED covers.

Lines.Text: using a t8 screwdriver , remove the 3 screws that attach the shell and motors together .
repeat this step on all 4 motors .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a T8 screwdriver, remove the 3 screws that attach the shell and motors together. Repeat this step on all 4 motors.

Lines.Text: using a spudger or pick , carefully pry your way around the seam , undoing the clips that attach the shell together .
pro tip : if you are replacing the shell because your old shell is trashed , don't worry about cracking or damaging the broken shell . just go for it .
do not try to pull the shell completely apart just yet , there are some cables that must be unplugged first .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger or pick, carefully pry your way around the seam, undoing the clips that attach the shell together. PRO TIP: If you are replacing the shell because your old shell is trashed, don't worry about cracking or damaging the broken shell.  Just go for it. Do not try to pull the shell completely apart just yet, there are some cables that must be unplugged first.

Lines.Text: using your fingers or needle-nose pliers , gently unplug the cables by pushing in the white clips on the sides and sliding the cables out .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your fingers or needle-nose pliers, gently unplug the cables by pushing in the white clips on the sides and sliding the cables out.

Lines.Text: using a knife or flathead screwdriver , remove the melted plastic rivets holding down the led board . be careful to not damage the led .
carefully pry up the led board from the drone shell .
repeat on all four wings .
during reassembly use a dull soldering iron tip to remount the led board to the new shell .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a knife or flathead screwdriver, remove the melted plastic rivets holding down the LED board.  Be careful to not damage the LED. Carefully pry up the LED board from the drone shell. Repeat on all four wings. During reassembly use a dull soldering iron tip to remount the LED board to the new shell.

Lines.Text: using a small screwdriver , carefully pry up the motor and led cables where they are glued down to the shell .
repeat on all four wings .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a small screwdriver, carefully pry up the motor and LED cables where they are glued down to the shell. Repeat on all four wings.

Lines.Text: all 12 of the motor wires that connect to the drones mother boards .

'''''++do not++''''' cut the cables with wire cuttersthey are enameled wire and are a pain in the butt to solder back together and have them still work . do yourself a favor and just desolder them from the board .
for reassembly , note the order of the cables . while the drone is upside down , black is the top wire , grey is middle , and white is bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750|Desolder|new_window=true] all 12 of the motor wires that connect to the drones mother boards. '''''++DO NOT++''''' cut the cables with wire cutters—they are enameled wire and are a pain  in the butt to solder back together and have them still work.  Do yourself a favor and just desolder them from the board. For reassembly,  note the order of the cables.  While the drone is upside down, black is the top wire, grey is middle, and white is bottom.

Lines.Text: using a t8 screwdriver , remove the four screws that mount the battery bay and brains from the upper shell .
carefully remove the brains out of the upper shell .

Lines.Text: carefully peel the shielding sticker from the upper shell . note that you can't remove it all the way until you remove three screws .
using a phillips 000 driver , remove the three screws that are mounting the board to the upper drone shell .

Lines.Text: carefully pry off the screw covers on the legs that are attached to the lower shell .
using a t6 screwdriver , remove the two screws . repeat on all four corners .
take note on where you are removing the cables from , and install them in the new lower shell in the same way you found them .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pry off the screw covers on the legs that are attached to the lower shell. Using a T6 screwdriver, remove the two screws.  Repeat on all four corners. Take note on where you are removing the cables from, and install them in the new lower shell in the same way you found them.

Title: Protocol Dronium III AP Camera Replacement

Lines.Text: ensure the drone is powered off .
press in and lift battery compartment cover .
a soft pry tool may be used for easier access .

Steps.Text_raw: Ensure the drone is powered off. Press in and lift battery compartment cover. A soft pry tool may be used for easier access.

Lines.Text: remove battery pack from body of drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove battery pack from body of drone.

Lines.Text: disconnect white connectors between the battery pack and drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect white connectors between the battery pack and drone.

Lines.Text: remove the eight ( 8 ) 5 mm screws attaching the motor arms to the body using a jis 00 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the eight (8) 5mm screws attaching the motor arms to the body using a JIS #00 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the six ( 6 ) 5 mm screws attaching the body cover to the body of the drone using a jis 00 screwdriver .
remove the body cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six (6) 5mm screws attaching the Body Cover to the Body of the drone using a JIS #00 screwdriver. Remove the Body Cover.

Lines.Text: remove the two ( 2 ) 5 mm screws attaching the motherboard to the body of the drone using a jis 00 screwdriver .
lift the motherboard off the mounting position .
do not pull hard on the motherboard as solder connections are fragile .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two (2) 5mm screws attaching the Motherboard to the body of the drone using a JIS #00 screwdriver. Lift the Motherboard off the mounting position. Do not pull hard on the Motherboard as solder connections are fragile.

Lines.Text: remove the tape covering the camera with the tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the tape covering the camera with the tweezers.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic holding the ribbon cable connector with the tweezers .
be careful with the ribbon cable , it is easy to damage .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic holding the ribbon cable connector with the tweezers. Be careful with the ribbon cable, it is easy to damage.

Lines.Text: move the ribbon cable out of the way with the spuger .

Steps.Text_raw: Move the ribbon cable out of the way with the Spuger.

Lines.Text: remove the camera by gently prying it out of the bracket with the spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the camera by gently prying it out of the bracket with the spudger.

Subject: Camera

Lines.Text: grip the arm , which is located underneath the propeller , with one hand , and with your dominant hand grip the center of the propeller .

Steps.Text_raw: Grip the arm, which is located underneath the propeller, with one hand, and with your dominant hand grip the center of the propeller.

Lines.Text: twist the propeller from the locked to unlocked position as indicated by the images of the lock .
you will need to twist in this direction for 2-3 full rotations before the propeller will detach .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist the propeller from the locked to unlocked position as indicated by the images of the lock. You will need to twist in this direction for 2-3 full rotations before the propeller will detach.

Lines.Text: lift the propeller off the motor .
to remove the silver-top propellers , repeat these steps , turning the propellers in the opposite direction of the black-top propellers .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the propeller off the motor. To remove the silver-top propellers, repeat these steps, turning the propellers in the opposite direction of the black-top propellers.

Lines.Text: lay the drone flat with the side containing the gimbal face up .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the drone flat with the side containing the gimbal face up.

Lines.Text: locate the three , 11 mm screws surrounding the gimbal .
there should be a screw to the left , right , and one directly in the front of the gimbal .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the three, 11mm screws surrounding the gimbal. There should be a screw to the left, right, and one directly in the front of the gimbal.

Lines.Text: using the j1 phillips head screwdriver , unscrew each 11 mm screw surrounding the gimbal .
turn the driver in a counter-clockwise direction for each screw .
note that the screws will loosen , but will not come out of their sockets completely .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the J1 Phillips Head Screwdriver, unscrew each 11mm screw surrounding the gimbal. Turn the driver in a counter-clockwise direction for each screw. Note that the screws will loosen, but will not come out of their sockets completely.

Lines.Text: once all three screws are loosened , use the smaller , plastic opening tool to carefully lift the panel that encases the gimbal by placing the square shaped end of the opening tool into the crevice between the panel and the rest of the device .
be sure that the end of the opening tool is facing inward , towards the screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Once all three screws are loosened, use the smaller, plastic opening tool to carefully lift the panel that encases the gimbal by placing the square shaped end of the opening tool into the crevice between the panel and the rest of the device. Be sure that the end of the opening tool is facing inward, towards the screws.

Lines.Text: gently begin lifting the panel with the opening tool by moving your hand in a downward motion , causing the panel to lift from the device .
work your way around the entire square panel doing this same motion until it is loose enough for you to pull off with your hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently begin lifting the panel with the opening tool by moving your hand in a downward motion, causing the panel to lift from the device. Work your way around the entire square panel doing this same motion until it is loose enough for you to pull off with your hand.

Lines.Text: once the gimbal and panel is loose enough to pull off with your hand , gently remove both the panel and the gimbal from the device .
when doing this , be sure to leave the micro sd cable inside the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the gimbal and panel is loose enough to pull off with your hand, gently remove both the panel and the gimbal from the device. When doing this, be sure to leave the micro SD cable inside the device.

press in and lift battery compartment cover .
a soft pry tool may be used for easier access .

lift the motherboard off the mounting position .

Lines.Text: '''this step contains a tool that can present a potential burn hazard . '''
prepare and warm up a soldering iron .
position motherboard so that the l . e . d . bulb solder joints are accessible .
use the soldering iron to melt the solder joints .

For more detailed instructions on how to solder, visit out [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750|How to Solder and Desolder Connections] guide. Lines.Text: now that the battery is out , remove the screws starting with the four smaller ones on the top part of the battery . after this , remove the last four on the side . make sure to keep track of where each screw came from .

there is another screw that is located where the arrow is pointed . you will need to take the other screws out first before you can get to this one .

Lines.Text: pry the gold wi-fi antenna connector , located under the previously removed foam pad , away from the wi-fi transmitter board to disconnect it .
''be sure to only apply force to the gold connector and not the black wire attached to it , as the connection between the two is very fragile . ''

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the gold Wi-Fi antenna connector, located under the previously removed foam pad, away from the Wi-Fi transmitter board to disconnect it. ''Be sure to only apply force to the gold connector and not the black wire attached to it, as the connection between the two is very fragile.''

Lines.Text: remove the two 3.8 mm phillips 000 screws from the wi-fi transmitter board .
''be careful with the delicate ribbon cable attached to the camera . ''

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 3.8mm Phillips #000 screws from the Wi-Fi transmitter board. ''Be careful with the delicate ribbon cable attached to the camera.''

Lines.Text: disconnect the white clip that connects the four colored wires ( black , orange , red , blue ) to the motherboard .
''be sure to pull only on the white clip , as to avoid damaging the wires . ''

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the white clip that connects the four colored wires (black, orange, red, blue) to the motherboard. ''Be sure to pull only on the white clip, as to avoid damaging the wires.''

Lines.Text: gently pull the black wedge away from the main board until it shifts to a stop . you will feel it slide out , then stop .
''the black insert acts as a wedge to keep the ribbon cable attached to the board . the wedge needs to be jostled loose before the cable can be removed . ''
lightly pull the ribbon cable away from the connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the black wedge away from the main board until it shifts to a stop. You will feel it slide out, then stop. ''The black insert acts as a wedge to keep the ribbon cable attached to the board. The wedge needs to be jostled loose before the cable can be removed.'' Lightly pull the ribbon cable away from the connector.

Lines.Text: the battery is accessible through the back of the drone .
press the tabs on both sides of the white stripe to pull the battery out .

Steps.Text_raw: The battery is accessible through the back of the drone. Press the tabs on both sides of the white stripe to pull the battery out.

Lines.Text: now that the battery is out , remove the screws starting with the four smaller ones on the top part of the battery . after this , remove the last four on the side . make sure to keep track of where each screw came from .
there should be one 7 mm phillips head screw , three 6 mm phillips head screws , and four 5 mm phillips head screws .
there is another screw that is located where the arrow is pointed . you will need to take the other screws out first before you can get to this one .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that the battery is out, remove the screws starting with the four smaller ones on the top part of the battery. After this, remove the last four on the side. Make sure to keep track of where each screw came from. There should be one 7 mm Phillips head screw, three 6 mm Phillips head screws, and four 5 mm Phillips head screws. There is another screw that is located where the arrow is pointed. You will need to take the other screws out first before you can get to this one.

Lines.Text: remove the top piece , and gently pry the two halves apart . divide the sticker if necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top piece, and gently pry the two halves apart. Divide the sticker if necessary.

Lines.Text: the battery is now removable from its container .
during reassembly , make sure the outlet is returned to its holder and faces the correct direction .

Steps.Text_raw: The battery is now removable from its container. During reassembly, make sure the outlet is returned to its holder and faces the correct direction.

Lines.Text: remove the 4x 7 mm phillips head screws on the outside of the shell , and the 2x 5 mm phillips head screws from the middle , then remove the back part of the housing .
remove the two hidden screws at the bottom , and the white power button .
there will be 6x 7 mm phillips head screws , and 2x 5 mm phillips head screws in total .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 4x 7mm Phillips head screws on the outside of the shell, and the 2x 5mm Phillips head screws from the middle, then remove the back part of the housing. Remove the two hidden screws at the bottom, and the white power button. There will be 6x 7 mm Phillips head screws, and 2x 5 mm Phillips head screws in total.

Lines.Text: unplug all the cords from the circuit boards .
carefully slide the main body off of the arms .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug all the cords from the circuit boards. Carefully slide the main body off of the arms.

Lines.Text: remove all screws from all four arms , and the screws on either side of the center .
the screws on the arms are 7 mm .
the screws on the motor are 9 mm .
remove the 5 mm screw holding the rotor onto the drone .
'''note''' there should be 22x 7 mm phillips head screws , 8x 9 mm phillips head screws and 1x 5 mm phillips head screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove all screws from all four arms, and the screws on either side of the center. The screws on the arms are 7mm. The screws on the motor are 9mm. Remove the 5mm screw holding the rotor onto the drone. '''Note''' There should be 22x 7 mm Phillips head screws, 8x 9 mm Phillips head screws and 1x 5 mm Phillips head screw.

Lines.Text: gently pry apart the upper and lower part of the shell by working the opening tool along the middle seam .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pry apart the upper and lower part of the shell by working the opening tool along the middle seam.

Lines.Text: unscrew the motor screws , and remove the motor .
there will be 2x 6 mm phillips head screws .
pry up the middle portion of the arm to access the cables .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the motor screws, and remove the motor. There will be 2x 6 mm Phillips head screws. Pry up the middle portion of the arm to access the cables.

Lines.Text: remove the motor by unsoldering the cords from the main circuit board .

the motor will either have blue and red cords , or black and white cords , with two of each kind on opposite sides of the drone . it is important that the new motor spins the same direction as the old one , and that you connect the leads to the correct port .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the motor by unsoldering the cords from the main circuit board. The motor will either have blue and red cords, or black and white cords, with two of each kind on opposite sides of the drone. It is important that the new motor spins the same direction as the old one, and that you connect the leads to the correct port.

Lines.Text: remove the chrome shaft cover by lightly pulling it away from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the chrome shaft cover by lightly pulling it away from the drone.

Lines.Text: using a phillips 000 screwdriver , remove the 7 mm screw from the propeller stop .
be sure to apply adequate pressure when removing the screw to prevent stripping it out .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips #000 screwdriver, remove the 7mm screw from the propeller stop. Be sure to apply adequate pressure when removing the screw to prevent stripping it out.

Lines.Text: remove the propeller stop from shaft by lightly pulling it away from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the propeller stop from shaft by lightly pulling it away from the drone.

Lines.Text: remove the propeller from shaft by lightly pulling it away from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the propeller from shaft by lightly pulling it away from the drone.

Lines.Text: remove the 8 mm long phillips 0 screws ( 24 total ) from the lower housing unit .
take care to place the screws in a safe place to prevent losing them .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 8mm long Phillips #0 screws (24 total) from the lower housing unit. Take care to place the screws in a safe place to prevent losing them.

Lines.Text: separate the upper and lower housing units by lightly pulling the two housing units apart .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the upper and lower housing units by lightly pulling the two housing units apart.

Lines.Text: remove the 3 outer 8 mm long phillips 0 screws from the lower drone housing .
remove the 2 inner 3 mm long phillips 0 screws from the drone motor .
place screws in a safe place to prevent misplacing them .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the  3 outer 8mm long Phillips #0 screws from the lower drone housing. Remove the 2 inner 3 mm long Phillips #0 screws from the drone motor. Place screws in a safe place to prevent misplacing them.

Lines.Text: remove the two 6 mm long phillips 0 screws from the lower motor cover located on the underside of the drone .
place the screws in a safe place to prevent misplacing them .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 6mm long Phillips #0  screws from the lower motor cover located on the underside of the drone. Place the screws in a safe place to prevent misplacing them.

Lines.Text: remove the motor cover by lightly pulling it away from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the  motor cover by lightly pulling it away from the drone.

Lines.Text: unclip the wire plug by applying light pressure to the wire plug with the plastic opening tool , and remove the motor .
this plug can be a bit difficult to remove , but it does not require much force to remove .
avoid damaging the plug and wires when unclipping wire plug .

Steps.Text_raw: Unclip the wire plug by applying light pressure to the wire plug with the plastic opening tool, and remove the motor. This plug can be a bit difficult to remove, but it does not require much force to remove. Avoid damaging the plug and wires when unclipping wire plug.

Title: Protocol Galileo Stealth Light Emitting Diode (LED) Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the 8 mm long phillips 0 screws ( 24 total ) from the lower housing unit .
take care to place the screws in a safe place to prevent losing them .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 8mm long Phillips #0 screws (24 total) from the lower housing unit. Take care to place the screws in a safe place to prevent losing them.

Lines.Text: separate the upper and lower housing units by lightly pulling the two housing units apart .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the upper and lower housing units by lightly pulling the two housing units apart.

Lines.Text: remove 6 mm phillips 0 screw from the led strip .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove  6mm Phillips #0 screw from the LED strip.

Lines.Text: remove the led strip from the housing by applying light pressure away from the lower housing with the plastic opening tool .
take care not to damage the led strip when removing it from the lower housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the LED strip from the housing by applying light pressure away from the lower housing with the plastic opening tool. Take care not to damage the LED strip when removing it from the lower housing.

Lines.Text: unclip the wire plug from the motherboard by applying light pressure away from the motherboard with the plastic spudger .
avoid damaging the wire plug , wires , and motherboard when removing the wire plug .

Steps.Text_raw: Unclip the wire plug from the motherboard by applying light pressure away from the motherboard with the plastic spudger. Avoid damaging the wire plug, wires, and motherboard when removing the wire plug.

Subject: Light Emitting Diode (LED)

Title: Protocol Kaptur GPS Main Circuit Board Replacement

Lines.Text: the battery is accessible through the back of the drone .
press the tabs on both sides of the white stripe to pull the battery out .

Steps.Text_raw: The battery is accessible through the back of the drone. Press the tabs on both sides of the white stripe to pull the battery out.

Lines.Text: now that the battery is out , remove the screws starting with the four smaller ones on the top part of the battery . after this , remove the last four on the side . make sure to keep track of where each screw came from .
there should be one 7 mm phillips head screw , three 6 mm phillips head screws , and four 5 mm phillips head screws .
there is another screw that is located where the arrow is pointed . you will need to take the other screws out first before you can get to this one .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that the battery is out, remove the screws starting with the four smaller ones on the top part of the battery. After this, remove the last four on the side. Make sure to keep track of where each screw came from. There should be one 7 mm Phillips head screw, three 6 mm Phillips head screws, and four 5 mm Phillips head screws. There is another screw that is located where the arrow is pointed. You will need to take the other screws out first before you can get to this one.

Lines.Text: remove the top piece , and gently pry the two halves apart . divide the sticker if necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top piece, and gently pry the two halves apart. Divide the sticker if necessary.

Lines.Text: the battery is now removable from its container .
during reassembly , make sure the outlet is returned to its holder and faces the correct direction .

Steps.Text_raw: The battery is now removable from its container. During reassembly, make sure the outlet is returned to its holder and faces the correct direction.

Lines.Text: remove the 4x 7 mm screws on the top and bottom , and the 2x 5 mm screws from the middle , then remove the back part of the housing .
remove the two hidden screws at the bottom , and the white power button .
there will be 6x 7 mm phillips head screws , and 2x 5 mm phillips head screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 4x 7mm screws on the top and bottom, and the 2x 5mm screws from the middle,  then remove the back part of the housing. Remove the two hidden screws at the bottom, and the white power button. There will be 6x 7 mm Phillips head screws, and 2x 5 mm Phillips head screws.

Lines.Text: unplug all the cords from the circuit boards .
carefully slide the main body off of the arms .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug all the cords from the circuit boards. Carefully slide the main body off of the arms.

Lines.Text: remove the four screws , and unsolder all cords on the circuit board .
there will be 4x 4 mm phillips head screws .
it is important to keep track of where the leads came from . red/blue and black/white pairings belong to motors , whereas black/red pairings belong to lights . the ports are labeled on the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four screws, and unsolder all cords on the circuit board. There will be 4x 4mm Phillips head screws. It is important to keep track of where the leads came from. Red/Blue and Black/White pairings belong to motors, whereas Black/Red pairings belong to lights. The ports are labeled on the board.

Subject: Main Circuit Board

Title: Protocol Galileo Stealth Pinion Gear Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the chrome shaft cover by lightly pulling it away from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the chrome shaft cover by lightly pulling it away from the drone.

Lines.Text: using a phillips 000 screwdriver , remove the 7 mm screw from the propeller stop .
be sure to apply adequate pressure when removing the screw to prevent stripping it out .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips #000 screwdriver, remove the 7mm screw from the propeller stop. Be sure to apply adequate pressure when removing the screw to prevent stripping it out.

Lines.Text: remove the propeller stop from shaft by lightly pulling it away from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the propeller stop from shaft by lightly pulling it away from the drone.

Lines.Text: remove the propeller from shaft by lightly pulling it away from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the propeller from shaft by lightly pulling it away from the drone.

Lines.Text: remove the 8 mm long phillips 0 screws ( 24 total ) from the lower housing unit .
take care to place the screws in a safe place to prevent losing them .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 8mm long Phillips #0 screws (24 total) from the lower housing unit. Take care to place the screws in a safe place to prevent losing them.

Lines.Text: separate the upper and lower housing units by lightly pulling the two housing units apart .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the upper and lower housing units by lightly pulling the two housing units apart.

Lines.Text: lift the pinion gear off the motor shaft by lightly pulling it away from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the pinion gear off the motor shaft by lightly pulling it away from the drone.

Title: Protocol Kaptur GPS Virtual Reality Lens Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the phone slide from the virtual reality lens .
take the outside cover off using a plastic opening tool .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the phone slide from the virtual reality lens. Take the outside cover off using a plastic opening tool.

Lines.Text: remove each screw from its place .
four screws will be 6 mm phillips head .
twelve screws will be 7 mm phillips head .
pull each bracket out so you can see the full lens case .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove each screw from its place. Four screws will be 6mm Phillips head. Twelve screws will be 7mm Phillips head. Pull each bracket out so you can see the full lens case.

Lines.Text: you will need to remove the adjustable lens lever on top of the virtual reality lens .
using a tweezers , you will need to separate the tooth gears and remove them so the lens can fall freely out .
pull the lens case out from the front of the headset .

Steps.Text_raw: You will need to remove the adjustable lens lever on top of the virtual reality lens. Using a tweezers, you will need to separate the tooth gears and remove them so the lens can fall freely out. Pull the lens case out from the front of the headset.

Lines.Text: to get the actual lens out , you will need to push the lens from the outside in with a little force to break the lens out of it's case .

Steps.Text_raw: To get the actual lens out, you will need to push the lens from the outside in with a little force to break the lens out of it's case.

Subject: Virtual Reality Lens

Title: Yuneec Typhoon H Spring Clip  Replacement

Lines.Text: using a jis 00 screwdriver , unscrew the 3 mm oval screw .
the oval screw is hard to remove once fully unscrewed , to remove the screw flip the drone upside down to have the screw fall out .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a JIS #00 screwdriver, unscrew the 3mm oval screw. The oval screw is hard to remove once fully unscrewed, to remove the screw flip the drone upside down to have the screw fall out.

Lines.Text: for this step the arm must be bent .
remove the broken arm clip by pinching the metal top and then pull it out with an upward force .
the blunt nose tweezers may be helpful in removing the arm clip .

Steps.Text_raw: For this step the arm must be bent. Remove the broken arm clip by pinching the metal top and then pull it out with an upward force. The Blunt Nose Tweezers may be helpful in removing the arm clip.

Subject: Spring Clip

Title: Yuneec Typhoon H Slip Ring Yaw Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the motor battery component from the drone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the Motor Battery Component from the Drone.

Lines.Text: prop the top cover of the motor piece off the motor battery component . using phillips 00 screwdriver , unscrew the three screws ( their lengths are 5.9 mm ) that are in this top cover piece . this will remove the battery from the top piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Prop the top cover of the motor piece off the Motor Battery Component. Using Phillips #00 screwdriver, unscrew the three screws (their lengths are 5.9 mm) that are in this top cover piece. This will remove the battery from the top piece.

Lines.Text: grabbing the motor piece , remove the bottom cap of this motor piece . the cap should pop right off .

Steps.Text_raw: Grabbing the Motor Piece, remove the bottom cap of this motor piece. The cap should pop right off.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 000 screwdriver , unscrew the two 5.9 mm screws and remove the retaining clip on top of the motor piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Philips #000 screwdriver, unscrew the two 5.9 mm screws and remove the retaining clip on top of the motor piece.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 1 screwdriver , remove the four 6.3 mm motor mount screws on top of the motor piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Phillips #1 screwdriver, remove the four 6.3 mm motor mount screws on top of the motor piece.

Lines.Text: once these screws are removed , pop off the top of the motor piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Once these screws are removed, pop off the top of the motor piece.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 000 screwdriver , remove the two 4.9 mm screws on the side of the plastic cover holding the wires together .
once these screws are removed , press down on this plastic cover to reveal the wires . pull the locking tabs that are on the end of this piece to completely remove this plastic cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Phillips #000 screwdriver, remove the two 4.9 mm screws on the side of the plastic cover holding the wires together. Once these screws are removed, press down on this plastic cover to reveal the wires. Pull the locking tabs that are on the end of this piece to completely remove this plastic cover.

Lines.Text: pull out the white wire connecter that is currently in the wire assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull out the white wire connecter that is currently in the wire assembly.

Lines.Text: remove the white wire connector cap using the tweezers . this is for the wires that are currently in the motor piece . do take note of the orientation and order of the wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the white wire connector cap using the tweezers. This is for the wires that are currently in the motor piece. Do take note of the orientation and order of the wires.

Lines.Text: removed the damaged slip ring motor by guiding the wires through the opening in the motor piece . use a pair of pliers to make sure the wires are pushed through the opening in the center of the motor piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Removed the damaged slip ring motor by guiding the wires through the opening in the motor piece. Use a pair of pliers to make sure the wires are pushed through the opening in the center of the motor piece.

Subject: Slip Ring Yaw Motor

Lines.Text: hook your fingers on the tab and pull out the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Hook your fingers on the tab and pull out the battery.

Lines.Text: locate stabilizer collars unlock and lock symbols . twist the collar counterclockwise to unlock the stabilizer from gopro karma body .
place the gopro karma on a stable surface with the legs folded in and the stabilizer facing towards yourself .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate stabilizer collar’s unlock and lock symbols. Twist the collar counterclockwise to unlock the stabilizer from GoPro Karma body. Place the GoPro Karma on a stable surface with the legs folded in and the stabilizer facing towards yourself.

Lines.Text: remove the stabilizer by pulling the entire stabilizer out of the drone body .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the stabilizer by pulling the entire stabilizer out of the drone body.

Lines.Text: flip the drone upside down with the landing gear out .
remove the four 1.2 cm long hex screws with a hex 2.0 screwdriver in the four corners of the landing gear

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the drone upside down with the landing gear out. Remove the four 1.2 cm long hex screws with a Hex 2.0 screwdriver in the four corners of the landing gear

Lines.Text: push with your thumb and pull up with your fingers to remove the landing gear .
caution : the landing gear is connected by a thin cable so do not pull too far away .

Steps.Text_raw: Push with your thumb and pull up with your fingers to remove the landing gear. Caution: The landing gear is connected by a thin cable so do not pull too far away.

Lines.Text: flip over the landing gear and locate the cable connector .
use your thumbnail to disconnect the cable and free the landing gear .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip over the landing gear and locate the cable connector. Use your thumbnail to disconnect the cable and free the landing gear.

Lines.Text: hook your fingers on the tab and pull out the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Hook your fingers on the tab and pull out the battery.

Lines.Text: locate stabilizer collars unlock and lock symbols . twist the collar counterclockwise to unlock the stabilizer from gopro karma body .
place the gopro karma on a stable surface with the legs folded in and the stabilizer facing towards yourself .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate stabilizer collar’s unlock and lock symbols. Twist the collar counterclockwise to unlock the stabilizer from GoPro Karma body. Place the GoPro Karma on a stable surface with the legs folded in and the stabilizer facing towards yourself.

Lines.Text: remove the stabilizer by pulling the entire stabilizer out of the drone body .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the stabilizer by pulling the entire stabilizer out of the drone body.

Lines.Text: flip the drone upside down with the landing gear out .
remove the four 1.2 cm long hex screws with a hex 2.0 screwdriver in the four corners of the landing gear

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the drone upside down with the landing gear out. Remove the four 1.2 cm long hex screws with a Hex 2.0 screwdriver in the four corners of the landing gear

Lines.Text: push with your thumb and pull up with your fingers to remove the landing gear .
caution : the landing gear is connected by a thin cable so do not pull too far away .

Steps.Text_raw: Push with your thumb and pull up with your fingers to remove the landing gear. Caution: The landing gear is connected by a thin cable so do not pull too far away.

Lines.Text: flip over the landing gear and locate the cable connector .
use your thumbnail to disconnect the cable and free the landing gear .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip over the landing gear and locate the cable connector. Use your thumbnail to disconnect the cable and free the landing gear.

Lines.Text: remove the two 1.2 cm long hex screws with a hex 2.0 screwdriver and set them aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 1.2 cm long hex screws with a Hex 2.0 screwdriver and set them aside.

Lines.Text: remove both locked connectors by pushing the connector release tool into the hole in the center and pulling up with the white handles .
the connector release tool is only included with the purchase of a replacement arm from the gopro website .
if you do not have a connector release tool , use a small screwdriver to push each tab while pulling up with the white handles .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove both locked connectors by pushing the connector release tool into the hole in the center and pulling up with the white handles. The connector release tool is only included with the purchase of a replacement arm from the GoPro website. If you do not have a connector release tool, use a small screwdriver to push each tab while pulling up with the white handles.

Lines.Text: remove the cover plate by pulling up on the side .
feed each connector through the hole and set aside the cover plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cover plate by pulling up on the side. Feed each connector through the hole and set aside the cover plate.

Lines.Text: loosen the 2 cm long hex screw in the arm with a hex 2.0 screwdriver .
the screw will not come out but loosen it until it can rotate easily .
pull up and off the broken arm .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the 2 cm long hex screw in the arm with a Hex 2.0 screwdriver. The screw will not come out but loosen it until it can rotate easily. Pull up and off the broken arm.
